However, the prices were quite expensive compare with other Indian restaurants. I would not mind paying if the food was good, but taking into consideration what we ate, it was a real waste of time. We shall not be back.

I account for possible sitting time on the plate until it got to our table. The flavours were heavenly. Loved the few accent roasted cubes of cheese too. Hubby‚Äôs eggs Benedict was excellent. Yolks were a tad too hard again but possible wait time from service pick up. Crispy side fries. Buttery croissants and fabulous breads! Returning later to try their dinner options.

title: Mixed review
text:
We recently visited the Ocean Blue Beach House at the Salalah Crown Plaza Hotel and had a mixed experience. The standout aspect of our visit was the impeccable service, especially from Ms. Shashin. She was attentive, friendly, and went out of her way to ensure we had an enjoyable dining experience. Her exceptional service truly enhanced our evening.

However, we were somewhat disappointed with the weekend dinner buffet. We had expected a broader selection of dishes, but the options were quite limited. Despite this, the fried rice and noodles prepared by Chef Rocky were outstanding. These dishes were full of flavor and were the highlight of the buffet.

Overall, while the service at Ocean Blue Beach House was exceptional, the variety in the buffet could use some improvement. We hope to see more options in the future that match the quality of Chef Rocky‚Äôs creations.

title: Bland but nourishing
text: This restaurant has several outlets, or at least 2 that I know of. My review is based on the one 'downtown', old Salalah on As Salaam St. near Al Qoaf cross street. I ordered vegetable American-style chow mein in the Chinese sectiion. Awful, I didn't even touch it. Presentation counts. They brought out a bowl of rosy-orange semi-transparent glop with shavings of cabbage and carrot, that was it. All topped generously with those long noodly looking croutons. I have eaten several times at the other Al Kutaini, out in Dahariz on Sultan Qaboos road (main road). I'Il assume they offer the same menu - they look identical. Other dishes tend to be on the fiery side. They are best at Indian recipes, especially those that they serve up sizzling on a hot plate. But keep away from "Chinese" or any other national dish. They haven't got a clue.

title: Great Pakistani Restaurant in Salalah
text:
I had dinner here together with my wife. We choose to dine in one of the family rooms of the restaurant and the service was really great.

We tried a variety of Pakistani food and when asked we replied we would love to have it spicy. So the cook prepared a very tasty not too spicy meal for us and told us if we want to have more or less spices he'll change that for us. But for us it was just fine and very very tasty!

At the end we were given a traditional dessert that was also very yummy.

Great service and very affordable! The next time we're in Salalah, we'll be back!

title: Great, wholesome food after a day's exploring the wonders of Salalah
text: My family and I booked a few's days adventure in Salalah, after a day's exploration we arrived back to the city centre feeling famished, obviously new to the town I asked the locals for somewhere authentic and reasonable to eat... and all the recommendations pointed to Al Kutaini. We arrived and saw it was really busy full of local people (a really good start). We were seated in the family area, this meant that my wife and I and our two children were give a cubicle of our very own resembling a hospital A&E room more than a restaurant... Our waiter arrived shortly, and was really helpful in assisting us to make our food choices. My wife and I chose a variety of curries, with tandoori roti - she is vegetarian, however surprisingly there was lots of food options for her too, from daals to vegetables. My children opted for noodles and omelette and chips. Our order arrived, by which time I was ravenous, happy to report the food did not disappoint, it was full of flavour and spice and very authentic. It's like going to your favorite auntie's house and being indulged to the max with traditional home cooked food. We ordered chicken curry, chana daal, and lady-finger curry, & chicken tikka, each dish had its own distinct flavour, very tasty. The restaurant is of Pakistani origins and the cuisine is typical authentic food hailing from Lahore in the  Punjab. The service was great and our waiter could not do enough for us, as we were sat in a cubicle there was a very novel way of calling for additional service - there is a door bell suspended on the wall near the a/c switch! The portion sizes are very substantial, the meal was very reasonably priced. One cautionary word, their menu is vast with an array of other cuisines, my sincerely advice if eating here stick to their specialty Asian food, they cannot cook anything else... frankly my daughter's order of noodles tasted really bland with zero flavour... but why go to a Pakistani restaurant if not to eat Pakistani food! Would I visit again? Well we did the very next evening!

title: Awesome and reasonable food
text: We visited on 28th Dec and order Pakistani food everything is good but there Chicken handi and Mutton kababs are mind-blowing

title: Very tasty food, reasonably priced
text:
Al Kutaini may not look like a very stylish place from outside but it offer great food and very good service. Most of the food items are from Pakistani cuisine and tend to be on the spicy side, though you can find non-spicy dishes too.

The only downside is that they only accept cash which, considering the panedemic situation, may come as a hindrance to go there since many prefer to pay by card.

title: Horrible Hortons - Stale donuts!
text: When you pay top-dollar for indulgent food, you should really feel that eating those excessive, hollow and empty calories is truly worth it! Brought a box of donuts to take home for a treat for the family. I cannot stress how disappointed I was with their product. The donuts were not at all fresh, and I would wager that they were unsold stock from the previous day! the selection was stale dry and totally inedible if I was in-shop and served these I would have totally complained. Seriously ASDA back in the UK do a bumper pack of 12 donuts for ¬£2 (OMR 1), and they were better quality and value than these... the donuts sat on the kitchen worktop for a day and then straight into the bin!

title: Excellent Iftar meal
text:
This review is for the Al Seeb Foodlands restaurant.
We booked an Iftar meal as a group. The restaurant had a very nice atmosphere and was busy. The staff were excellent throughout and coped well with the demands of the customers.
Some food was already placed on the tables while the main courses and desserts were provided by self service buffet.
The food was delicious and plentiful, staff were replenishing and monitoring everything.
We had a very enjoyable evening and will definitely be booking again. Well done to all of the staff and the owner.

title: Foodlands, Al Seeb -  Tasty & hygenic place!
text:
We dined at the Foodlands, Al Seeb branch 4 times during our stay in Muscat.
We tried Indian food & would rate it 4 stars (out of 5).
They have a wide food choice including oriental.
The 1st floor has ample space with 2 family dining rooms.  You can also see the live kitchen where Chefs prepare your food.
The Manager & the staff are very welcoming & well trained. The waiters also offer good food recommendations but aren't pushy about it.
Above all, its a very clean & hygenic restaurant.
Ample parking available. 
Note : It does not serve liquor.
Definitely a go-to place for us during our future visits to Muscat.

The items were brought in order with enough time gaps. Service was quick and food was tasty. Ambience was nice, but AC was too strong right in front of it. Huge parking lot.

Don‚Äôt recommend Dominos Pizza in Mubailah - Opposite Sultan Taymour Mosque and Wadi Al Kahir branch. But from my experience, I think all will follow the same strategy with scarce ingredients!

Many items (like tea) are prepared and stored, not made fresh to order- this is same situation in many hotels, due to staff constraints.

text: Today evening was our 3rd visit (in same type of clothes as before). One waiter came and showed a table for two. Suddenly he got an instruction (? From where) and told us "shorts" not permitted. Question in our mind- a dress allowed previously not allowed now. Manager was no where to be seen. We promptly responded with thanks and left. Afterall there are many similar restaurants. Message to owners- not only you have missed few valuable Riyal but potentially a repeat customer. By the way no caution on your web site or on door about dress code.

We skipped the starters and went directly to the main course. We ordered Vegetable Hakka Noodles, Chili chicken boneless, Vegetable American Chopsuey, Steamed fish in Hoisin sauce and Mixed Fried Rice.

text: I rate this place excellent  because they have the best service I ever seen in Oman,,,the staff very profissional and freindly,, the food I would say it is not as expected,,the prawns used are frozen and barely to find crab in the cuisine if ordered,,,the tum yum was not as good as other places I did try.

title: Indo-Chinese cuisine in perfect balance
text:
As we were about to leave, our sweet Indian waiter revealed that The Golden Oryx gets many guests from Al Falaj, where we are staying for a couple of days. It only takes a 5-minute stroll from the hotel to the restaurant and vice versa.

The food and mocktails (non-alcoholic) are top-notch. Our mango/tamarind daiquiri and passion fruit lemongrass mojito were wonderfully delicious.

The steamed shrimp dim sum were on par with some we had in a hardcore Chinese dim sum joint in Penang.

Sichuan fried rice with chicken and spicy lamb in oyster sauce and chili maintained a similar level.

The portions were generous, the prices extremely reasonable, and the service exquisite. What‚Äôs not to like?

title: Great food and service
text: This is one of the best Chinese restaurants I have been to. Their food is great. I think they choose their ingredients carefully as you can feel that from teh taste of their dishes. Their service is also exemplery.

text: We love tasty food !and all menu just wow !anying you ordering it's soooooo tasty love it !Always happy to visit  Mani's caffe

title: One of the best travel experiences
text:
It‚Äôs a great ambience, nice views from the seating area. Lots of variety food everyday. Staff were very good paying attention to even smallest needs. Greeting you with smile every time. We felt really special experience. 
They have intercontinental, Arabic as well as Indian food counter. 

Indian chef is Mr Moorthi is from Chennai, INDIA and he served variety of excellent dishes during our stay of one week. Usually places like this food feels repetitive but we didn‚Äôt experience it. The ingredients they used were high quality too. For example I noticed drumsticks and baby shallots in sambar, one day they served saboodana khichadi which tells me about their attention to details. 

The resort as whole is very nice located in a beautiful part of the city. Staff is extremely friendly and they just can‚Äôt do enough for you. There are lots of activities for all ages of children. Definitely we well visit again.

title: Great Experience
text:
**Review for alTanoor Restaurant**

alTanoor Restaurant is a gem that offers an exceptional dining experience, particularly during breakfast. The variety of food options available in the morning is impressive, catering to all tastes and preferences. From traditional breakfast dishes to more adventurous options, there's something for everyone.

The pastries at alTanoor are truly outstanding. They are some of the best I've ever had‚Äîfresh, flaky, and delicious. Whether you're in the mood for a classic croissant or a more unique pastry, you won't be disappointed.

The service at alTanoor is equally commendable. The staff is friendly, attentive, and always ready to help, making your dining experience even more enjoyable. If you're looking for a place with great food and excellent service, alTanoor is definitely worth a visit.

title: Family Friendly Al Tanoor of Shangri-La Barr Al Jissah

text:
Surprisingly nice. Good Indian and some Chinese dishes. Very well prepared, and very flavoursome. Very clean. Attentive helpful service. 
Nice decor, if a little faded. The restaurant stands out above most others in Mutrah. Quiet peaceful location on the front road of the harbour.

title: Excellent place to have a meal for a special loved one.
text: Had gone to celebrate a friends birthday last evening. Every aspect of the restaurant is outstanding,  the service, food & ambiance was awesome. This is a must visit if you are planning a mean for a special occasion or a loved one. Left with the lingering feeling that we must return

title: A hidden gem at Mattrah Corniche...
text:
A nice cozy restaurant at Mattrah Corniche.  Lovely food, attentive staff and the service was impressively quick for a fine dining spot.  Whether you are planning a romantic dinner or a fun night out with friends and family, this place has something for everyone.

We loved the must try dishes like Prawn poori, dry coconut lamb and the biryani specials. The Kurkum Special Seafood curry was to die for.

Amazing place.  Totally recommend it.

title: Excellent for experiencing traditional Omani cuisine
text: This restaurant is delightful both for its traditional Omani decoration and food. If you are looking for an authentic experience of Omani cuisine and culture, I highly recommend this place. The service is attentive and the view from the balcony is wonderful.

title: An Experience to do
text: A great place to taste and experience Omani traditional food, shwa and camel meat, also the soup made with camel meat was so delicious and spicy, the smell of Luban everywhere was strong and I liked it but it's really expensive compared to other restaurants in the area.

title: Shuwa
text:
It seems really hard to find a restaurant serving Omani cuisine in Muscat ; most advertise "Turkish" food. So Bait Al Luban was a refreshing find. The setting is wonderful : located near the fish market at the end of the Mutrah Corniche, it overlooks the port and has an Omani interior.
They offer a complimentary Luban drink before you order. I had to choose shuwa, the slow-cooked lamb that comes with rice and some dips. The serving was enormous and more than enough for lunch. No alcohol is available, but I had a really nice mint/ginger drink. After dinner you get a free Omani coffee and some juicy dates.

title: Omani specialities
text:
When staying in Muttrah I never went anywhere else for dinner than at the 'Bait al Luban' (the House of Frankincense), a place I enjoyed very much. First one goes up some stairs, then there is a welcome by a Filipina looking young lady (not always the same), who places one at a table and who also takes the reservations. The waiters were young men, probably from the Indian subcontinent. Generally all the staff were very friendly and professional. The interior decoration is traditional Omani style.

There is a menu card in English and Arabic with an interesting choice of mainly Omani dishes. As appetizers I twice had the 'Gheleambe', a speciality from the Sharqiya region: Watercress salad with shallots and cherry tomatoes in a dried lemon dressing. Fantastic. Another time I went for 'Sahnat Qashe', thus sundried Anchovies with cherry tomatoes and spring onions, put into a form. The very small fish were tasty, but rather tough.

The main courses were always accompanied with rice, either as 'Makbus' (cooked in a vegetable broth) or as 'Qabouli' (in a meat broth). Once I had 'Hammour' (Rockcod), then 'Qabouli Laham' (meat broth rice with pieces of lamb in it) and  'Shuma', the Omani celebration dish with the meat having been cooked for six hours in an underground firepit. Tasty again, but the lamb a bit stringy.

At the end they offered a glass of Frankincense water and local dates. Together with a fresh Mint tea I also ordered once a 'Khabeesa' as dessert, a Date and Cardamom Roux in Saffron and Rose water, served with Vanilla Ice Cream. The next time it was a 'Luqaimat', dumplings soaked in Cardamom, Saffron and Rose Syrup, something I knew as 'Lokma' in Turkey or 'Loukoumades' in Greece.

title: Fantastic Omani restaurant
text:
A lovely Omani restaurant with traditional vibes.
We really enjoyed their rice dishes.
Excellent service and finished with Qawa dates.
Thank you guys for a traditional Omani experience.

text: I like this place in Bahrain, delicious food and great vibes, friendly staff specially Riza , my favorite place in Bahrain

title: Energetic and delicious
text: Clay offers a fantastic, energetic atmosphere with great Arabic and English music. Our server, Reda, provided exceptional service and the best recommendations. The food was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend Clay for a lively and memorable dining experience!

title: I highly recommend this restaurant
text: We had a lovely meal here last night with my friends,  Served by handsome staff,  energetic and very kind GM Mr. Santi The vibes here pretty  amazing, cozy and charming atmosphere! food presentation amazing and taste is really good.

title: A Fusion of Flavors and Vibes
text: Clay Bahrain Lounge offers a unique dining experience, blending Japanese and Peruvian cuisines in a stylish atmosphere. The menu boasts innovative dishes like sashimi tacos and Andean short ribs, while the cocktail list is equally impressive. The lounge area, with its trendy decor and live entertainment, creates a vibrant ambiance perfect for socializing. Expect a high price point, but the overall experience is worth it for those seeking a sophisticated night out.

title: Doctor khawaja
text: As I visited maki this weekend, I had one of the best experiences trying the Japanese cuisine. From the makis that I tried to the main dishes I ate all was fantastic. The food was unique and compared to most bahraini Japanese restaurants maki stood out for me. The service was immaculate and the waiters were respectful and welcoming. My favorite dish was the edamame salad where I found it was something unique and delicious which I recommend to the people that are gonna give maki a try. It was not actually my first time going, although with every single time I visit maki I fall in love with the atmosphere and the consistency of their dishes. I really wish the best for the restaurant and I hope it continues providing outstanding service and food in the future

title: A food experience you won't regret.
text: I came with a couple of freinds and this place did not dissapoint. We tried various different foods there and really loved it l. My personal favorites on the menu were the Mongolian beef, the chicken plum boa buns and the volcano Maki. All the ingredients are fresh as well so everything tasted sensational.

title: A culinary experience to die for
text: The whole lunch service was amazing the makis are the best in Bahrain. The new interior of the restaurant is very modern and simple you just fall In love with the environment.

title: Incredible staff, beautiful surroundings, and top tier food. Maki is a must try and will definitely visit again
text:
As me and my friends were visiting the newly renovated Maki, I was expecting big change.
Not only was the staff, environment, and ambience outstanding, but the food itself succeeds in quality and taste. As we were seated, the staff was incredibly helpful and kindhearted while taking our orders and serving our food. Seats were comfortable, tables were spaces nicely, but most importantly the overall restaurant was beautiful. We tried a variety of things from the menu, and they did not disappoint at all. All of the things on the menu are a must try but one recommendation would most likely be their bao buns. Overall, I enjoyed the experience there with my friends and loved the food. Maki is a must try.

title: Taste of Innovative Japanese Cuisine!
text: It was our first time as inhouse diners. Easily accessible through Moda Mall Gate No.1; Maki has designated parking available with  access through the parking area besides the main entrance. The interiors are ecletic in light brown and paper mache lights at the entrance. Artecrafts beautifully adorn the entrances  without disturbing the contours. Simple and elegant seating makes the ambience warm especially for dinner with family. Pleasantly surprised to see a variety of vegetarian dishes on the menu. Kudos for including red rice and gluten free dishes too. The red rice dishes were delicious with lingering flavour. Variety of sushi with fresh ingredients satiate the non vegetarians too. Service is quick and staff are congenial. The highlight of the evening was the desert " Fusion Surprise" which  resembled a mushroom. This heavenly masterpiece has a base layer of green tea, middle portion is a soft white body infused with a filling of berry puree and capped with a circular topping of hard  milk chocolate enclosed in two chocolate  discs . Warm chocolate sauce is then poured just before you indulge in devouring this experience. Thankyou Ruksana for recommending this desert. Thankyou Vinish of client service for patiently explaining the ingredients of the desert while pouring the warm chocolate sauce. Thankyou Sajini for guiding us through the menu and all the servers of the evening. Last but not the least the Sous Chef and his team deserve a special mention. It was a memorable evening savouring innovative Japanese cuisine.

title: Great views
text: Bar at top of Four Seasons hotel. As per usual in Middle East drinks are stupidly expensive but ladies get 2 free drinks on Saturday nights! Great views and atmosphere and large TV‚Äôs showing UK football so due to time difference it was nice having a nightcap and watching the football

title: Khobar
text: Worst of the worst the cancel my reservation last minute and they put me in a very bad position after I planned everything never count on them on any future occasions

title: Good experience but really bad communication
text:
I had such an amazing night but the best way to ruin my birthday was to see the receipt where they charged me for bringing my own cake. 
the most expensive thing on my bill was this. 

Its such a stupid thing because i had brought my own knife, candles and did not ask for any plates. The staff hadn't informed me about this at all. 
I talked to them about bringing my cake before coming and they even saw our cake they didn't inform us. This was absolutely disappointing.

title: Badly advertised
text: This restaurant is advertised as being on a boat with a trip through the Bay. This seems to have changed within the last year but that is not communicated. The restaurant is now just on a floating pontoon which you pay 10BD just to sit on. It doesn't move and if it's windy to be honest it makes you feel kind of sea sick. The menu is cheap but the food is not great. Our calamari was so overcooked and the chicken wings were basically just chicken nuggets. The spinach and chicken risotto was good and the v-lounge salad was also good but the price just to sit on a floating pontoon is not worth it. It's a dry restaurant as well which isn't an issue but again the reviews below make it seem like there is wine etc available so that was what we had planned for. I get that this restaurant seems to have moved and changed since being right outside the four seasons but this needs to be clear on their website and when you call. The setting is nice but the photos make it look very lavish and a big spoil but it is very down to earth more casual than smart.

title: Floating Lunch
text:
One of the astonishing place where we enjoyed lovely moments on floating Lounge called "V Loung". Food was outstanding with very professional service. 
This amazing Lounge is highly recommended for Birthday parties and other family or business activities or functions.

title: Breakfast and Lunch
text:
Had breakfast throughout my stay and lunch one day, this place literally spoils you for choice. One of the best all day dining restaurants I‚Äôve been to. The selection extends from asian to western and middle eastern cuisines.
For breakfast you can choose from Chinese dim-sum and noodles to all various kinds of croissants waffles and Manakish with your choice of eggs. The halloumi manakish was one of my favourites as well as the waffles here were very fresh. The infused water is also such a good idea for those who prefer to stay away from juices. The staff here are also very attentive and friendly.

title: Crowded Easter brunch mayhem
text:
My husband and I had brunch at Bahrain Bay Kitchen at the Four Seasons on Easter Friday, not really realizing it was a specifically ‚ÄúEaster‚Äù brunch until we turned up and saw the amount of people and Easter-themed activities (for children) and chocolate eggs.

We are die-hard brunch aficionados, frequently planning our travel itineraries to accommodate luxury, free-flow brunches. In theory, this should have been a very good experience; a beautiful venue, nicely set-up buffets and a friendly welcome. In practice, however, there were unfortunately a number of irritants:

- a massive amount of people had been crammed into one space. A number of the tables around us appeared to be children (in their hundreds, it felt) celebrating birthdays. Parents were present but seemed more preoccupied with the cocktails. A free-flow brunch usually evolves or disintegrates (depending on your view) at some point in the afternoon to a very lively affair. In this case, though, it was all a bit too much and way too crowded, loud and busy.

- drinks service was very slow. Our waiter was friendly and obviously did his best, but he only had two hands. Our glasses often went empty. It became a game of ‚Äúspot the waiter, try and grab his attention and hope he remembers to bring you something at some point.‚Äù

- no champagne, only sparkling wine.

- the only cocktail station available served only a couple, anything but innovative, drinks. I asked for a fruity cocktail with vodka (vodka and gin were the two choices available). I was told they could only do a mix with pineapple and orange juice. Boring. At the same time, waiters did serve other cocktails as well, but you had to know to ask for them. In consequence, one table ordered mojitos, and this gradually spread so that everyone in the entire restaurant was ordering mojitos. Then one table ordered another drink, and everyone started ordering that drink.

Overall, the food was good but a Friday brunch is about so much more than just the food.

title: Best brunch place in bahrain
text: We go occasionally to the brunch in the four seasons and never got disappointed. The food and service are far better than most places in the kingdom even though pricing is a bit higher. Make sure to book in advance since they are full for most of the days. Highly recommended!

title: 11th hour Brunch at Bahrain Bay Kitchen
text: After an excruciating journey from Saudi to Bahrain with various delays at customs and passport checks, my wife and I arrived late for Friday brunch at the Four Seasons Bahrain Bay hotel. Thankfully, Fabian Apel and his team offered to accommodate us at the last moment with a table for two. Having been ushered off to collect as much as we could before the brunch was completely closed and the covers cleared, we were kindly offered drinks by Fabian and his team that made up for our mishaps. Lobster, king prawn, grilled chicken, various samosas and various other delights were gratefully consumed, followed by a couple of welcome cappuccinos. Excellent service and very considerate, well worth a visit...

title: Friday Brunch
text: An excellent Friday Brunch.  The chef's from each station were proud to talk about the food that they had prepared.  Lovely seafood, sushi, authentic Lebanese food, a roast dinner, stir fry prepared just for you, amazing slices of pizza that just melted in your mouth and tandoori chicken.  The deserts looked and tasted amazing particularly the coconut mouse with mango inside a chocolate coconut shell.  Lots of flavours of ice cream and great juices to drink.  All of the staff were really friendly, polite and helpful.  Live music (a singer and guitarist)  was great and not too obtrusive. There was a lovely atmosphere in the restaurant. One of the best places that I've eaten in the world. BHD35 per person with soft drinks.  There is an alcoholic drinks package too.

title: Amalia
text: Amazing Experience Staff is Wonderful, and will be back for sure! The food was hot and fresh, the place is amazing for family and friends, and I would rate it a 10/10.

title: Breakfast with friends outstanding and perfect experience
text:
We gather as friends for breakfast on a Friday the place is amazing with a perfect view as marina in front of the Resturant  great options when it comes to Arabic breakfast all perfect and the services is great too so friendly and helpful 

They have a place for kids as well with choices of food for them

title: Excellent
text: Hands down the best Lebanese restaurant I tried in Bahrain. The service was very good and the food was amazing. Very good view too, the private rooms are perfect for watching football matches with family or friends

title: Amazing place
text: The restaurant is gorgeous, serves excellent Lebanese cuisine, and is located on the sea and the marina, very nice experience

title: Very good
text: Exceptional dining experience with authentic flavors and warm hospitality. The creamy hummus, tender kebabs, and fresh tabbouleh are standout dishes. Very good service and the lotus cheesecake was very good. Perfect for a true taste of Lebanon highly recommended for food lovers!

title: Nice Hookah bar/cafe
text: Great environment wonderful staff and always very kind to customers. Very nice place to enjoy an evening. The food is good, and juices are wonderful. Great Sheesha too

title: One of the best chilling place in Amwaj. The Shisha place is perfect, football matches are always open.
text: In addition, the restaurant has really amazing food, and the view is amazing and is perfect for friends to chill and watch football.

title: Manama bahrain
text: Very friendly delicious food reasonable price and nice view of the lagoon..highly recommended..there is a lot of varieties. They serve big portions. I liked the tekka nasal and biryani..

title: Lunch
text: Love the food. Especially the butter nun together with butter chicken and some gravy. Good service as well. Amwaj branch. üëå

title: THE Best Indian restaurante in Bahrain
text: First of all, ask for the cheese garlic nan, then go with a Chicken korma or a Murgh saagwala for drinks, they have a super fresh fruit juices. Top choice!

title: Great value for money!
text: Went here for dinner for the first time last week and was delightful. The service was quick, the food was lovely and the price was great! well worth a try if you haven't already.

title: excellent indian traditional
text: excellent indian traditional food one of good restaurant in bahrain amwaj island nice sea view .highly recommended

title: Tasty Breakfast
text: Tasty eggs Florentine! Cute spot in the mall with tasty breakfast. It has a small spot for little children to sit and play with stuffies. Staff are kind and Ohana made for a great start of the day.

title: Calming Sunday Breakfast
text: This spot is great for a breakfast. I ordered the eggs Benedict and a toffee nut late. The late was amazing! I would recommend this place for a calm relaxing breakfast.

title: Great food great people
text: The food was fresh and super tasty!! The two guys cooking were super polite and made us feel welcomed. We will be coming back!

title: New Spot in Amwaj
text:
Very cosy place in a relaxing ambience , food is freshly made and the coffee is really good .
 Staff are very polite , friendly and efficient

title: The best coffee!
text:
The service is perfect and friendly, food is great as well so delicious ü§ç 
Best coffee ever ! 
Food is great as well !! 
Breakfast so delicious and fresh!

title: Recommended
text:
There‚Äôs no relation to Beirut, just in appetizer , but the atmosphere, music, are normal .
Good prices, good meals, but need more for kids.

title: Good
text: The location and ambient was very good. The personnel is very nice and costumer focused. Our family add a great time.

title: Very delicious
text:
We went there with 4 persons. As Lufthansa crew we travel a lot around the world and the Angham Beirut was one of my favorite restaurants.

Delicious food. Very nice and attentive staff.

Thanks for your service. 

Next time again.

title: sheesha cafe place
text:
if you are a shisha lover this is a place for you, 
prices are reasonable the lebanese cuisine is fairly good 
best is the shawerma plater, clean and good service 
located in the amwaj lagoon, a nice place to have a walk

title: Excellent food
text: Great food and excellent service.  Traditional Lebanese food was amazing.  Very friendly staff.  The Lagoon has lots of restaurants that are closed down, but certainly worth coming to eat at Angham Beirut.

title: Nice spot
text: Whenever I‚Äôm in Bahrain I have to visit this place for a short break and have their hookah with this amazing view. Servers as usual are friendly, cafe is clean, in general excellent experience and best time to visit is before sunset.

title: Dinner with my friends
text:
Yesterday, we invited our friends from Saudi to Veranda Amwaj for dinner...

Staff was hospitable, food was good and shisha was excellent... Ventilation system was efficient in clearing the smoke and keeping the air conditioned area cool...

I do recommend this restaurant for good food and shisha while enjoying the lagoon sea view...

title: Cosy place with interesting decor
text: Loved the place. Located at Amwaj Lagoon with nice view. Feels very Cosy & has interesting unique interior.  Food & sheesha was good. On the ground floor they have General section & you can go upstairs for family Section. Recommended to visit.

title: Good
text: The location and ambient was very good. The personnel is very nice and costumer focused. Our family add a great time.

title: Out with friends
text: Good food and hookah nice outdoor sitting and view very nice for out with friends i come nearly a very week to relax

title: Best sports bar in Amwaj
text: Jovial staff. food is good. Glad they lowered their prices. Best place to watch football in Amwaj now and enjoy a vold beer.

title: Nice choice
text:
A calm and dark bar to have conversations.. thats why we were there..
They also serve light meals..i recommend

title: Bad experience
text: After 5 years of being a regular attendee of this pub, last night I told them that it is going to be my last. I was offered with a friend  bad Guinness pints that taste like vinegar. The only way to offer us a better one was a canned Guinness from the next door restaurant. The nachos were not well prepared. The place is going downhill and it is losing its reputation especially after new owners took over last winter. I do not recommend this place at all.

title: 1st visit
text:
Waited for more than 20 minutes to get the food even the place was empty on 1 guy on the bar ! When the food was served it was  cold !

title: Nice ambience to relax

text:

The service was not professional at all.

The food quality was great and tasted good and is suitable for family dining as there is a various selection of different food options, in spite of that, the habit of some of the staff regarding the service is not appropriate and doesn‚Äôt live up to the standard of good serving, they really need to be trained about the proper way to communicate with customers and create a welcoming environment, particularly the waiter ‚ÄúRasel‚Äù.

title: in the face of changing covid restrictions still had a good evening
text:
as covid rules changed on the 2nd day of Eid, we called ahead to see if we could still go for dinner as we only had 1 shot each.

we were able to sit in the outside area which was ideal.  the lagoon was quiet. maybe as a result of the pandemic, the changing rules or due to Eid family celebrations.

waiting staff were helpful and attentive.  1st place we've been in a while with a physical menu instead of a QR code to scan and online menu.

pepper beef salad was almost a main course in it's self.  the fillet steak was also very good.

nice spot for a meal and a few drinks, prices reasonable for BH.

title: Amazing Night at Celluloid
text:
Celluloid is an amazing place. The food are great, the entertainment is much greater. They have a 3 piece band and they are very good. The singer, she's a fire cracker, amazing voice and great customer rapport.

You have to check this place out. Highly recommended!!

title: Celluloid experience
text:
My family & I have been a frequent visitors to Celluloid for several years  and I have never faced any issues , the staff have always been courteous and attentive, great service , good food and I would not hesitate to recommend celluloid to any of my acquaintances.

Keep up the great work

title: Night out
text:
Absolutely love this place 
Great food 
Fantastic staff 
Friendly people 
Good music 
All round fun night out

title: Worst experience
text: Worst experience ever. Food terrible. All dishes arrived separately with the first dish arrived 3/4 hour before the next person. The service was so bad. We will not return.

title: Good Kerala Food
text:
Visited this restaurant for dinner. Restaurant is situated in basement of the building. Kerala Feel is evident right from the entrance. Traditional oil lamps with fragrance welcome customers. Area of restaurant is large with approximately 50 Pax capacity.

Food is mainly Keralite though it serves other types too. Drinks are served here. Availed Beer tub with 5 beers with Tee Shirt thrown free as gift. Service is good with smiling faces. Restaurant has total Kerala ambience with houseboat, fountain at central place, other Kerala motifs.

Selected Kerala food of traditional chicken & mutton gravy with Appams. Appams were delicious. Gravy preparations excellent. Complementary sweet dish of Paysam too good. Understand that restaurant serves traditional Kerala Thaly in the afternoon. Rates were reasonable 

Overall excellent Kerala food with great service. Highly recommended

title: Dinner at nattinpuram
text: We went to nattinpuram restaurant for dinner, after eating all kind of international food for 15 days, we were desparate to have some spicy kerala food, we got puttu and kadala, excellent ambiance and excellent service

title: Delicious Thai Cuisine
text: Another great Thai Restaurant in Bahrain! I love their tom yum soup. They were also serving maki! The place is always busy so I suggest you gotta come earlier to get a seat.

title: Mr. AlBastaki
text: Very local Thai style restaurant and food the service is ok not bad food is excellent and delicious, staff are friendly and attentive one problem is the parking very difficult

title: My Top Local Venue for Thai Food in Bahrain except for Noodles
text:
I like to order the spicy beef salad, pork red curry with three bowls of rice and the fried clams plate.  Only item I strongly recommend not to order -- noodles.  Easily the worst noodles of any Asian restaurant I have sampled in the world. Otherwise, I like it better than HoneyThai Restaurant. Good value for money. No alcohol.
Of course, given the reasonable cost of the meal, the interior is not fancy and I would recommend walking rather than driving there. Fine if you are eating alone or with (modest) friends. If you want to impress, however, go to the Thai restaurant in the Gulf Hotel. Pongs serves until late at night till 2am if I am not mistaken (though the latest I've been is midnight.)

title: Thai Treasure in Hoora
text:
Been there a couple of times. It always bring me joy to eat their noodle noodle soups. My personal fave is their chicken/shrimp wanton soup with egg noodles. I tried futo maki and a few others and I liked it as well. However their appetizers seems the same to me like the fish and shrimp cakes. 
The interior can be improved especially the washrooms because the smell is very unpleasant. But in total I really enjoy the food and the sushi chef was great (he gave us a complimentary sushi last Christmas).

title: An oriental experience
text: A very popular Thai restaurant that is tucked inside Hoora just rightafter BYC. Been dining in here theough the years. Good selection of Thai, Pan Asian and Japanese food. Try the crispy beef, roast duck or the sauteed vegetables with a little dash of toasted onions those are our personal favourites. The only downside is that they dont have credit card services so be sure you have cash with you. Can get crowded in the evenings during the weekend.

title: Dinner
text: This evening I treated my wife for beef tikka & kebab at the newly opened Al Kwar restaurant and grills in BuKawara (close to the AlKhalifa walkway & girls school). It's an exceptionally clean 2-storey restaurant, with the family section located on the first floor. The restaurant also has its own local bakery for fresh khabaz.  In addition to grills, the restaurant serves various local dishes, along with a breakfast menu. The staff were very friendly and attentive to our requests. Service was excellent. The restaurant has plenty of car parking close by, plus traditional benches where you can sit and enjoy sweet red tea after your meal. The restaurant offers free delivery,  but I strongly suggest that you personally give them a visit.

title: Must visit
text:
Very simple place that offers delicious food with good service at affordable prices.

Would recommend the fried tikka and kabab they are famous for.

title: Authentic Bahrain
text:
A spot where friends go for a quick delicious meal served efficiently.  No frills, but welcoming and well-run. An outstanding intro to Bahraini and regional dishes with a focus on grilled meat. 

Hot bread flies straight from the tandoor oven to your table throughout the meal. 

The price will leave you smiling too.

title: Standard
text:
Standard Starbucks. The staff is not so friendly I have to say.
I asked for non dairy milk and it was prepared in the mug labelled as "Dairy".
Cappuccino is always too hot.
Prices are good.

title: typical starbucks
text: no diffrent than any other starbucks coffee shop. service is top class and the coffee is fresh. you can meet poeple and chill very easily. a very freiendlly atmosphere.

title: Shopping & Entertainment
text:
During yesterday's visit to the Avenues, we stopped at Blaze Pizza and had delicious pizza, the crust was perfectly chewy and to my taste standard. Staff were welcoming with friendly smiles and were quick to greet you in. It is always great to walk back and forth in the Avenues, particularly if you are young, and want to meet up with friends you haven't met for years! The Public Security band added to our joyful experience, with sweet samosa and Arabic coffee being served too! 

We then decided to have coffee to another romantic place "Starbucks". The place is so clean, staff very friendly and welcoming. It also features a tasting room where they can offer small groups of customers a bespoke coffee tasting experience, but sadly to see certain clients throw garbage on the ground without any respect which gives an inappropriate idea about society.

title: Only this one from many in

the best ice latte ever!!!!the staff very friendly and accomodating specially Ms.Lovely.
nice ambiance and relaxing place 
definitely we will be back

title: Best coffee in bahrain
text: My favourite coffee shop in seef district!! They also serve amazing balaleet soft serve! I highly recommend trying their coffee, desserts and pastries!!

title: Best meat shawarma in Bahrain guaranteed
text:
My all time favourite shawarma shop in Bahrain. Dont miss out on trying it.

They are the first and only shawarma place that serves US Angus Beef!!

nice place located in seef mall. nice interior. i had coffee with a dessert. both of them were good. 

the desserts option are limited something i would like to suggest to work on.

Came for coffee and cake. 

My coffee was very bland (they can not do coffee). 

Macaroons were thick and cold (Laduree they ain‚Äôt!). 

Caramel Mille-feuille was  simply tasteless. The custard had no nice vanilla flavour and the crust was way too thick. 

Won‚Äôt be back!

very bad experience. coffee cold and not replaced by the shop

title: Cake and Coffee
text: I tried their Latte and cake and it‚Äôs done so beautifully. I love the designs and the cake is really good quality. Would definitely come again.

text: I had one of the best thousand-layer cake here! If you're in the move for some thousand-layer cake, you should check it out here. Good service too.

text: I ordered one dish which contains beans and meat, the meat was not fresh and bad in taste and smell, overall the restaurant atmosphere is fine but not quite because it is located in a Mall

title: Delicious and fresh.
text: Highly recommend it for breakfast and lunch. Appetizers and main dishes are delicious and fresh. I‚Äôm surprised that they provide daily dishes in a home-like way.

title: Poor service
text:
Services very poor to serve food and taking orderss
The seconds order the staff never respond and they don't care. 

For sure will not visit the restaurant again 

Thank you

title: Excellent food at a good price
text: We found this restaurant in the City Centre Mall whilst hunting for somewhere good to eat. It already had a large crowd of dinners whilst most other restaurants were empty. Food was great and well priced. I had the mixed grill, Jane had the Royal Shwarma. Massive portions.

title: Terrible food!!! Bad indigestion!!
text: Our experience was at Yasmine City Center. It was a terrible experience. Food was horrible and tasteless. The Humus was so bad that we could not eat it. The mixed grill had uncooked chicken and the meat was smelling. The coke zero that we ordered was probably regular coke as we never saw the can it came from. We had severe acidity and indigestion from the food. Terrible food!!

title: Delicious Ethiopian food in Adliyah
text:
Tango's doesn't sound like it would be an Ethiopian restaurant, and walking in, it doesn't look like a traditional Ethiopian restaurant... oh but what a treat you're in for if you venture in!

I ordered a vegetarian combo. It was pretty much the same as any Ethiopian restaurant with a mixture of potatoes and carrots (tikil gomen), mixed salad, split lentils (miser alecha) and ground chick peas (shiro wat). The shiro was was particularly delicious. Flavorful and just enough spice. There were also some stuffed peppers. I had a little fear about them... I wasn't sure how hot they would be. They were hot... but oh so flavorful. The injera had much more teff that Americans are used to eating, so it was more bitter than I'm used to, but I could really appreciate the authenticity that it gave me.

The restaurant has a bevy of activity. I was there during Ramadan, so there was no alcohol. I have no idea if they serve it, but there is a bar. It seems to be family run and the service was outstanding. Someone always wanted to bring me something, although I had everything I needed.

For an extra treat, hope to be there when they are roasting fresh coffee. A lady was hunched over a small flame next to me roasting (burning) the beans in a small pan. When they were cooked to perfection, she went in the back to grind them, then came back to make coffee in a small traditional pot over the flame. It smelled heavenly. I don't normally drink coffee at night but couldn't pass it up when offered. It was like an earthy chocolate taste. Delectable.

Tango's was recommended to me by an Ethiopian lady that I met. She told me she eats here often, and that was good enough for me. After one visit, I can see why she returns so often. It has a welcoming, family vibe and the food is really good.

title: Surprisingly very reasonable and good food Ethiopian food
text: We went to Tango for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed the Ethiopian food and the traditional presentation. The dishes are very reasonably priced and filling, so its really light on the wallet. The preparation of the Ethiopian coffee after the lunch was an absolute treat to watch and the freshly roasted and ground coffee served to you on the table was just wonderful!  They also have another menu card with non Ethiopian dishes, should you prefer to order dishes of different cuisines.

Joel's recommendation of trying one of Bahrain's  local fish was great. I had sheem which was light and flaky that was simply grilled with a side of veggies.

Friendly and knowledgeable service here. Fish Market Restaurant wants patrons to have a good dining experience and they succeeded.

title: My son and I visited Nando‚Äôs
text:
My son and I visited Nando‚Äôs on American Alley/Shabab Ave. in Juffair a few hours ago. 

We used our Entertainer app to order two MILD grilled Chicken Espitada (hanging skewers) with double fries and rice for side dishes. 

When we got our order after a long wait, the French fries were dark, crispy and cold. As soon as they brought it to the table, the manager was nearby and I asked her for a new, fresh order of fries. She stared at me blankly so I asked why they were so dark‚Äîwere they seasoned fries? I think she mumbled yes before walking away. 

My son and I proceeded to eat the chicken, which was very spicy hot. When I asked our waiter if it was mild, he said that ‚Äòmild‚Äô and ‚Äòmedium‚Äô spicy were the same thing. What? I know for a fact that‚Äôs not true since we‚Äôve eaten at Nandos before and it was deliciously prepared with much better service. Our mouths burned but we suffered through only because we were hungry and didn‚Äôt trust sending the food back and having wait another 30 minutes to get our food. 
We repeatedly had to ask for more napkins and finally ordered a soft drink, which the waiter was quick to refill (which was the only good thing about the meal).

Too many employees standing around doing nothing while providing mediocre service and burnt distasteful food. Announcing that we were going to use the entertainer coupon seemed to reduce overall professionalism; even from the manager. Even when we went up to pay, there were four people behind the register confused about how to ring our order up using the coupon. Very Disappointing and exasperating. 

Overall, the food and service tonight was totally unsatisfactory. We will be very hesitant to return to Nando‚Äôs at this location. They should hold their managers to a higher standard and train their many employees how to properly cook, prepare, and serve the food as well as how to effectively treat and communicate with their customers.

title: One of the best sushi restaurant in terms of flavors!
text:
Kojo by far is the best Japanese restaurant in terms of food quality. We have always been a fan of their dishes. Started from the famous Durrat Maki, Smoke Lava, and Hokkaido to trying out their other menu as well! Teppanyaki/Teriyaki grills are great. It was tender and well cooked. SALAD! Oh don't get me started with the salad. If you are on a salad diet, you definitely need to try their Crab Volcano Salad. When it comes to appetizers, there are also different delicious options. You have dynamite shrimp popcorn, edamame, and a special favorite of ours is the seafood soup. BUT if it is your first time, I would recommend going straight to their Kojo Specials first. There will be a high chance that you will be reviewing the restaurant like me as well!

Let's go to Atmosphere, shall we? Kojo interiors have that countryside Japan feeling. The lights are dim, there are private rooms and you will really feel the inspiration from traditional Japanese culture. I would suggest browsing their website since the images of the food and their outlets are posted there! Comfy and cozy and a great place for an intimate gathering with friends and family.

Service is superb! They really have great team/staff though the restaurant has a tendency to have busy hours. But still, I think that is similar to all the restaurants. They will assist you on your order. They were actually the ones recommended the food items to try and we thank them for that!

All in all, go to Kojo and try the specials menu. If you are already a fan of sushi, the taste can be described as modernized with a lot of flavors in it. If you are a first time Japanese cuisine customer, trust me, you are missing out on a lot of great food!

title: Huge Cockroach Found at The Restaurant Tabke
text:
Personally I was a huge fan of Al Abraaj food, I have visited almost all branches throughout Bahrain and tried almost everything on the menu, but my perspective towards the food and the quality flipped within minutes. 
I visited Al Abraaj Adliya Branch, today on the 24th of June 2023. 
After a hectic day at work, around 2, I headed over for lunch to the restaurant, ordered food and was waiting for it to arrive when suddenly a huge cockroach landed on my table half unconscious. 
My entire day was ruined within minutes. We headed back home all frustrated with the experience and didn‚Äôt feel like eating anything for the rest of the day. 
Pathetic experience, will never recommend anyone to visit the restaurant and furthermore will take this matter to the management tomorrow as they are closed today. 
Until then choose wisely! Food hygiene and safety should be our topmost priority while choosing a place to dine in.

title: Not the Al Abraaj we have known
text:
Al Abraaj¬† ( Adliya ) was our all time favorite¬† restaurant¬†, But our last¬† visit¬† in Feb 2024 was such a let¬† down .¬† Has the management and staff¬† changed ?¬†The food was pathetic¬†and tasteless¬†, we had order¬† our usually dishes which¬† we always liked¬† :¬†Kofta Ma'Laban (Chicken &¬† Meat mix )¬† was ok with few pieces scattered , but missing the usual taste¬† +¬†Beef¬† Stroganoff W/ White Rice¬† : I think¬† the chef forgot to put meat only had cut mushrooms¬†with  meat (only 1 cube cut into tiny pieces ,not stroganoff cut) , No taste¬†at all¬† - Seriously¬†I¬† prepare better at¬† home and it is still cheaper, even with¬† NZ fat free meat from supermarket +¬†Grilled Prawns - no comments for¬† 5 medium size Prawns for BD 5 .¬†
Service - What service¬†, the table is set and you sit down yourself . No one is around to take your order , you have to hunt and request to take your order or if you need anything , even the bill .¬†Once you¬† order they disappear¬†again and¬† only¬† come to you¬† with¬† the food and again disappear.  Although¬† the other tables were empty with very few customers , do not where they were¬†...
While eating¬† we heard¬† a very¬† angry customer who just paid and stormed out and his words were¬† "I am a very old customer, but this is my last visit ..I am never coming back , this is bad food ".¬†
We are guessing there may be other¬†similar¬† such customers . Wth the quality and quantity gone down , only the price is high ,¬† No one will return . We share the same thoughts .

text: I went with the family for Iftar (breaking the fast) and the restaurant managed to maintain its standards . title: Kimchi Korean food restaurant
text:
Kimchi Restaurant in Kuwait City is classified as a first class Korean restaurant. The restaurant is adjacent to the Radisson SAS Hotel and very close to the Kuwaiti Al Boom Ship Restaurant. A restaurant with a beautiful and calm Korean character and food. The way the tables are distributed and privacy for each customer.

I was hoping to add soy chips, as well as beetroot and turnip slices with the famous Korean vinegar juice. I thank the restaurant‚Äôs management and staff for serving us. We abstained a lot, a restaurant worth trying.

title: Cool location, food ok
text: It's a bit of a drive from the rest of Kuwait City, but for the drive we got an uncrowded and warm and peaceful small corner of the city that for a moment let us forget where we were. Easy to find a table, and the food wasn't bad but not outstanding. The only real flaw is that it's right next to a cross-fit studio, whose music and steroid-fueled clients can be annoying.

title: "Pesto" Lunch for 2 days
text:
I had two mains delivered for lunch.  I had the grilled salmon cut into cubes, with pesto sauce flavoured with coconut milk, on top of white rice on the 1st day & the Pesto Verda Pasta on my 2nd day. The salmon main was well-prepared and tasty. The salmon was soft and well cooked, the pesto had no coconut flavour though.  I had Pesto Verda Pasta with Cherry tomatoes on top as well. Both were tasty and truly enjoyable. 

SEE photos.

title: Fantastic food and service
text:
Nice, clean cafe with lovely decor. 
The Dasman Combo brunch was fantastic! Wonderful flavours and plenty of food for two people. The service here was great - we were brought extra hot bread and even offered more again after this. We paid just under 10 kd for breakfast with tea and fresh juices for two adults. Highly recommend this cafe.

title: GREAT food, BAD takeaway packaging!
text:
I had a healthy lunch at Q at the yard. The menu is varied. The yard is open for breakfast and lunch. I had roasted salmon fillet served with couscous, spinach and lemon butter sauce. This main is simple and pure main.  The salmon was softly cooked and the sauce was the best due to balance in flavor. The spinach was softly cooked and easily chewable. I love couscous; it is a great alternative to rice. It is super healthy and light.  My drink was the Iced peach tea.  You will prepare your tea. It is a casual tea ceremony! The Peach tea is mixed with orange juice and Lemon slices. You will have to add Liquid sweetener to balance the flavor for yourself.  I love dark chocolate. I have to try this bitter flavor, everywhere. I had Dark chocolate cake with salted caramel biscuit. It was a large portion. It was not too sweet. I had the remaining cake for takeaway. I unpacked the cake at home it was turned upside down. The best part of the melted chocolate was scattered around the container. A great Fast WIFI is available for uploading.  It takes seconds for a complete upload. 

The excellent rating is for the food, wifi, and settings.  The Poor rating is for messy packaging.  

SEE photos for food and interior.

title: My favorite week end breakfast place
text:
Q at the yard is a wonderful place where you can go at anytime of the day and have great food and listen to good music . The waiters are friendly and the service is good. The breakfast menu is delicious my favorite is the Egyptian assortment and the green goddess eggs.you have also Avery interesting  selection of fresh juices and coffee . I always have the Vietnamese coffee. Make sure to leave some space for the deserts especially the banofi and the home made chocolate cake .
Q at the Yard is wonderful

title: lunch
text: i love the food here its clean and healthy and delicious and fulfilling! the salmon couscous rice is so good so is the chicken fettahüëåüèºüëåüèºüòª their salads are great and they have good tasting caramel machiatto and moroccan mint tea and beetroot orange juice is a good healthy tasty option. the mothers cake is really yummy. i always go for lunch and def recommend it for lunch, haventtried bfast or dinner yet

title: Hawaii‚Äôs Wildly Popular Bowl
text:
I always order from Q at the Yard, the place is only 15-20 minutes by car from my neighborhood.  Q at The Yard is located in Sharq, opposite Dasman Complex. Graphic designers, Ala‚Äôa Ali Reda and Danah Behbehani, run Q at the Yard.   The food is well done and amazing. I am a frequent diner at the Yard. 
.
I love the bean & barley soup, it is a staple and healthy. I always receive the soup hot and steaming.  I had the shrimp in coconut curry.  The curry was light and aromatic. Each shrimp was soft and flavorful. The aroma of lemongrass and ginger was clear. Q at the Yard offers you 2 options of, white rice or quinoa. I prefer quinoa. 
.
Today I am having lunch again with them. I am trying a new item on the menu. It is PoQe Bowl; it is smoked salmon with arugula, one boiled egg, grilled artichoke in oil, cherry tomatoes, and avocadoes sprinkled with black sesame seeds.  You‚Äôve a choice of 2 dressings: lemon vinaigrette or soy dressing. By the way, their classic cheesecake and orange loaf are moist & delicious. I never hesitate to try a new dish, because I know that I will get a tasty main. My drink is always the beetroot and orange juice. The PoQe Bowl is simple and healthy.  This Hawaiian dish has been around for centuries. It‚Äôs basically Hawaii‚Äôs favorite food and for good reason: PoQe is healthy and simple.
.
SEE photos of barley soup, shrimp in coconut curry & PoQe Bowl.

title: Coconut Shrimp Curry
text:
We had lunch from this awesome place. We ordered Coconut Shrimp Curry with jasmine rice & Tomato Caper Pasta. We are still enjoying the Coconut Curry for years now. The quantity of this main is perfect for 1 person. The flavour comes enriched with lemongrass and ginger.  The Tomato Caper Pasta is another favourite of ours. It is a light and savoury dish with black olives. This main is full of flavour and incredibly simple to enjoy. By the way, we love the Mom‚Äôs cake as well. We will order the cake next time. 

SEE photos

title: A nice oasis in a loud and problematic space...
text:
The Dasman first/business class lounge is a great place to relax while waiting for your flight! Free internet, food and showers in a clean and quiet space that is staffed by friendly and attentive staff.

title: Good Lebanese restaurant
text: The ubiquity of Lebanese restaurants in the Gulf and general Middle East means that you can up your expectations when dinning out on this cuisine. I love Lebanese food and, having eaten at some spectacular places, can be a bit hard to impress. Nevertheless Leila does a good job. They have a wide variety of traditional dishes and it was all pretty good. I think the issue here would be price/quality, but as I didn¬¥t pay I can¬¥t say too much. I suspect it¬¥s pretty reasonable value. The only comment I would make is that the restaurant itself is fairly uninspiring with bland interior and cafeteria style layout. That said I would have no problem going back for lunch if I am in the area - I just won¬¥t be making a point of it. Apparently there are a few "Leila" restaurants across the region so it could well be a reference brand where you know you are going to get a pretty good meal.

title: Dinner
text:
The place looks inviting, but looks can be very deceiving. The waitress was at best unfriendly and the food was a complete disappointment. A hair in the salad did not bother me that much, but the medium filet steak i ordered was at best rare and the blood mixed with the sauce. Second of all the  reason why I said they are Burger King trained staff is that they actually let me paid for two persons while I‚Äôm here alone by my own self and when I confronted them why the hell did you double the price on the bell did you see anyone in front of me or did I told you myself that I‚Äôm waiting for someone she denied and she told me yes I asked you and you told me yes?? Wth is this the √©tiquette of French restaurant waiter service manual ???! Since when do the waiters stairs at me and give me looks unprofessional?? i got my money back not all of it but to the imaginary person of the waiter..! So unprofessional. The food is terrible too. Meat is cold plus not cooked well the sauce tastes different. Disappointing. Not worth the money nor the time. If you‚Äôre like me who believes in cleaneness, good service and food just don‚Äôt go back to alfanar branch.

title: Where is the steak?
text: The pieces of steak served to me were small ...not hot when served and not worth the money...I went to Alfanar branch...the waitress served the first plate with fries and 4 thin strips of steak and then another 4 thin strips of steak !!! I asked for more but told me only two serves!! It was my first visit and I did not like it ...

title: better than tripadvisor reviews
text: I nearly did not go based on the number of poor reviews. I've been to the original Relais de L'Entrecote in Paris so I made an effort and was happy I did. Firstly the staff (mainly Filipino) were excellent. I was greeted and served courteously and with a smile throughout. I went midweek at 8PM. The outside tables were busy but the inside had plenty of space. You know you're going to get steak and fries with a salad, but contrary to some reports my steak was tender, cooked medium rare as ordered and served with hot crispy fries. The steak is sliced into small pieces and the servers will bring an extra serving. In total it was more than enough and also decent quality. Reasonable value for about $35.

title: Mediocre
text:
This branch is a sister restaurant of Solo Pizza and I have to say that Solo Pizza is far better 
The service was fine but the pizza base in Doppio was too thin and very soggy 

Not sure I'd go back to this branch but try solo which is not as new surroundings but the pizza is great

title: Fantastic Pizza, better then some place in Italy
text: I'm in Kuwait for busines, and if I want to eat a really good pizza, I'll came here. Ingredients are made in Italy and service is fast. I suggest Caprese as appetizer and after the pizza SOLO. If you are still hungry, calzone with nutella is amazing, but is also too much

title: Not great but not bad either
text:
This is not my first time going to this place but as with all my  other reviews, I went there with my wife and we came out with the same outcome: it was average.

Don‚Äôt get us wrong, the food was good and the service was also good but does it mean that it is on the top of my list of places to eat. Not really.

If I just happened to be near it and I am craving a pizza then maybe I might go there, other than that, I would try the other places around it first.

JR pie is served with vanilla ice cream. The pie was on the large side. It was delicious as ever. The ice cream was creamy. The quality of the pie had not changed. title: Good food. Very slow service

Staff were friendly

title: Nice food!!
text: Very delicious food and great service from Melwin, it‚Äôs great for couples and close friends to come !

title: Sharq branch
text: Nice view and atmosphere at Souq Sharq. The staff is friendly. The breakfast was good. Many cats if you are sitting outdoor.

title: Needs improvement
text:
I'm reviewing the Avenues Mall branch for this restaurant. This morning, we had breakfast for the time in this place.
Menu with lots of variety, food presentation is good, food tastes above average,  mid to high price. 
One major issue I'd like to address is that all the bread slices burned, especially the edges; bread is essential to eat in breakfast but not that way. 
A bit slow service. 

Average overall.

title: Convenient location - good food
text: Good lunch option right near the mall, weather was decent so I sat outside. The service was good and the manager was helpful in arranging transport for me to my next meeting. The food was varied and my meal was good.

title: From excellent to average
text: This used to be my favorite spot for breakfast and lunch, especially when the weather was nice enough to sit outdoors by the water. A couple of months ago, the outdoor section was redone very nicely. However, the entire team of servers was also replaced with inexperienced ones. I went there 4 times since and the service was between average and poor.

title: Amazing service super tasty food with clean and comfortable place.
text:
The food was amazing also it was the best service I‚Äôve received it the team was super friendly especially Yatish he is positive and always smiling warmly 
Wooow experience for sure I will come always

title: Poor hospitality and staff behaviour
text:
Best location and ambience but poor very poor very very poor service. Staff is rude and can not expect hospitality from them. 

Worst experience.

title: Second Home
text:
Mughal Mahal service is very excellent and the workers there are very friendly, price is expensive but the food overall is delicious. I recommend this restaurant for families. The bathroom is really clean and very sanitary. The location is not bad and I come here frequently.

- From Meshary & Ali (biggest mughal mahal supoorters)

title: GYATTT
text: Good tasting food ever more tasty staff(i bet) the sexy mascot instantly attracted me towards the place the food was quick to be served the place was clean and had no bad odor, the manager looked amazing as always and the toilets are really clean and well structured (the voices are getting louder) ~ from Meshary and Ali biggest magal mahal supporter

title: Kuwait's Best Indian
text: Wonderful Indian food. The menu also featured Chinese style dishes. The portions were huge. I had trouble finishing my egg fried rice and Rawapindi Chana!! Staff were very friendly and attentive. I wish I had this restaurant on my doorstep in the UK. Can't recommend enough.

title: Lamb biryani
text: Great food!Delicious taste yum yum yum! Had lamb biryani and butter chicken. Definitely going back again with my whole family and friends

title: Surprised quality going down
text:
I visit this Reaturant twice a year it used to be my number one Reaturant in Kuwait however my last visit was last night July 28 .2022 my guest and I noted lots of difference in food quality most of the items we ordered didn‚Äôt taste same way used to be , food was smiling, oil used was used serval times , the famous dish the  duck we couldn‚Äôt eat it even though they removed it from my bill including the sweats but since I am very old client I don‚Äôt wish to see the standard of quality going down .

Tambora dish we couldn‚Äôt eat it at completely different taste ( not up to standard.).

We though the  chief is being changed .

title: Authentic restaurant, delicious food
text: The restaurant is very authentically decorated with proper, high quality dishware and cutlery; food is delicious and service excellent.

title: Best Peking Duck
text: Fortunately the service has improved significantly since my last review. The food is still great and no one does the Peking duck better, the food was great and the overall experience was pleasant as always. Overall recommended

title: Great place
text:
In my previous visit i was told by the receptionist there is a policy that the minimum charge is 20 kd per person 

The hospitality and the service was great 

The food was good  and they have the best chicken soup in town 

In the end 
I payed the bill whithout applying the minimum charge policy

title: First time in peacock
text: The food is very delicious, the quantity is perfect for sharing, the service is excellent, the staff are great the music was amazing service was excellent big thanks for all staff

title: Love this place
text:
My husband and I are seafood lovers. I grew up in the Gulf region of Texas so I am picky about my crab and shrimp. Dampa Feast has never failed. We usually order the Dampa Royale and it has crab scallops muscles and jumbo shrimp. Always delicious! 
The highlight of going to Dampa feast is our favorite waitress Stephanie! She always greets us with a smile and provides excellent service. She has remembered us since we came three years ago and when we are gone for long periods she is always there with a big smile to welcome us back. We tried going to two other locations in Kuwait, but it's never as welcoming as when when we go see Stephanie!

title: A new way of eating for me
text: The food was served quickly by pleasant staff, it was hot and tasty. A different experience for me eating with your hands. The lovely sticky rice made eating the prawns and sauce easy. I'd recommend going.

title: Dampafeast
text: I like dampa sea food its amazing taste especially Mexican sauce I visited last 2 days i enjoyed with my friend, The waiter Emanuel( African guy)is fast and energetic and helpful , but tilapia fish was small unlike before but it was delicious

title: Good Food
text: I ordered shrimp and mussels dampafeast with Cajun sauce, the food was well cooked and plenty, they put so much bay leaves that it overpowered the sea food smell and taste, also the Cajun sauce was not spicy.

title: Great experience!
text:
Great experience for me to try Filipino food. We ordered Shrimp with soya sauce.The food served very quickly and it was hot. The taste was very delicious not as what I expect! The restaurant has new experience eating by hand. They served gloves and apron to wear. It made the experience different!
Overall, The food was very delicious and the staff were very friendly!

title: Dinner party
text:
Nice place to visit with friends spending time with tang chao restaurant they are providing good service Mr vinod and team
Food was very tasty spicaly kung pao chicken noodles with chicken tang chao salad don't missit,

title: Well taken care of
text: I came to the restaurant hungry and was well taken care of by Devendra.  The food suggestions were helpful and the service excellent

title: Chinese restaurant with real Pekin Duck and nice atmosphere in it.
text: I was looking for specifically Chinese restaurant where I can have a proper Pekin Duck with rice pancakes and correct sauce. Restaurant Tang Chao met all expectations and very polite, respectful, given the space and time waiter Devendra brought the compliment Chinese Jasmine tea that was a perfect combination with food or after. The place has light background music what gives you abilities to have conversation, business meeting or just a date. Thank you for delicious dinner and lovely atmosphere, see you soon.

title: Great food, Great staff
text: Food was fantastic. Ordered king pao chicken n schezwan chicken. The taste of both was distinct and flavorful. Special thanks to Devendra for his hospitality. Will definitely come back

title: Great experience
text: Its really great spot to enjoy with ur frnd and family was really nice experience. I would love to this again and again. I enjoyed here too much . I would be verg happy

title: Good Ambiance but poor indian cooking
text: I chose the restaurant for its ambiance and my urge to have fine-dining Indian food. To my surprise, a fine dining place can put oil more than the required amount in the food. All of the dishes Veg biryani, paneer masala, mix veg, chicken curry, and chicken biryani were too oily. Our group could not finish anything and felt heavy enough after having a small portion of the food. Moreover, the food is expensive here.

title: Perfect
text: The best employee there is Sachin he is so much polite and professional, the best food i like there is butter shrimp and saffron rice with strawberry passion fruit juice, their starters are amazing also I rate it 10/10 for any kind of gatherings or even single, not to mention the view from kuwait towers branch üëçüèº

title: Review on my dinner - 17th Jan 2023
text:
With great expectations like we had at  Arabian Gulf branch many times, we opted a different location and was at Boulevard outlet with  some guests  last evening and ordered  'MEDIUM SPICY' food. The Butter chicken sauce  was spicy for the first time and we all kept a low profile as we did not want to embarrass the guests and  vice versa.  After reaching home, three of them noted to be sick and stomach upset due to the extra spice.  
Taste and quality of food is close to zero in comparison to Arabian Gulf outlet.  Now regret that the issue was not raised then and there but wanted to avoid all such issues infront of our guests.  It was a real embarrassment and such an unpleasant today after the call from our guests. Never again. Thanks

title: Kuwait Ashas at sea side, gulf road
text: Had lovely sitting arranged by the staff sea facing .. Wow... And enjoid the delicious food... ambeince was something i expected from alshaya....finally wanted to callout for 2 names for this experience... Manoj and Sunny.. Thanks guys

title: Place and the food are just awesome.
text:
Excellent services, they maintain cleanliness and take care of your need. 
The food quality and services are top-class. You should try it once. 
Server Ms. Sushmita was very humble and polite. Very courteous especially with elders.

title: If you are looking for good Indian food , once visit jamawar and try their food you will not get disappointed.
text: Good ambience and very good foods especially I like their bamboo biryani very unique taste . And thanks to the service team also very smart and attentive always smile in their face.Recommend everyone to visit here .

title: Yummy food
text: I had chicken tikka and garlic naan was very delicious. Good ambience. Friendly staff. I like the place very much. Definitely i will recommend my friends and family. Thanks to all team. Keep it up.

title: Jamawar very nice Indian restaurant
text: I dined in jamawar with my friend it was a nice experience of mine . I liked the ambience of the restaurant and the food was very delicious especially the chicken tikka and biryani and service was also very good. Recommended place to visit.

title: Nice hospitality
text: Gobi chilly was amazing. Nice ambience. Staff are very polite and friendly. I feel like home. I really enjoy my time. Thanks to all. I will visit again with my family.

title: Beautiful place
text: Nice ambience. Yummyyy indian food. I like it so much. Staff are very polite and friendly. I spent wonderful time. Thanks to all. Keep it up. I will visit again.

title: Nice place but I think it is over-rated
text: We went for lunch, we had no prior reservation, but the restaurant's manager kindly accepted that, and he gave us a table within a few minutes, although the place was very crowded. All the staff working in the restaurant are very friendly and attentive. The ambiance was good. As described in the previous reviews, this place serves Kuwait or Arabian Gulf traditional cuisines. We ordered the items in the photos attached. Frankly speaking, the food was not extraordinary. It lacks strong flavors. Overall, I can't judge the restaurant based on the few dishes that we ordered, as the menu is big and probably our choice doesn't represent the best items the restaurant serves.

Worst experience , rude supervisor and rude manager ,  slow service .

*The good taste of food is not enough when the customer service  is so bad !

If u decide to go there , Make sure to write down what u order , check what they put on ur table and compare it to the recite !

title: Great experience
text: Delicious meal - ordered the lamb, salad, hammour and hummus which were all fantastic. Additionally service was top notch. We were served by Paul who was very hospitable, warm and knowledgeable about the food and dessert

title: Horrible service.
text: Horrible service. We arrived at 12:30 for lunch and was told to be seated but the restaurant doesnt serve neither lunch or breakfast just sit and wait.. at 1:00 pm the food was supposed to be served but until 1:15 nothing is served since 12:30 pm.

title: Traditional vibes
