title: Babel Restaurant, Salmiya Kuwait
text: A fine dining Lebanese restaurant in Kuwait situated on the Marina Seaside Walk in the Salmiya District. Delicious food and nice ambience. Try out the seafood menus. Advance table reservation is required.

title: Spot on
text:
We were lucky and instantly found a table for us. Services was very good. Time of waiting to be served was ok. Dishes were spot on. Bread and else was yummy. actually the food was amazing. i recommend the Beiruti  hummus, yummy.

coming again for sure

title: One of the best restaurants in all of kuwait!
text: One of the best lebanese restaurants in kuwait!, The food was delicious that i couldnt stop eating it!. The restaurant was super clean. One of the best restaurants I‚Äôve ever experienced in kuwait!.

title: Great place but no customer satisfaction !
text:
I have visited the place and order for 1 small sparkling water and 2 mojitos and 1 dessert , one old guy in blazer recommended me the dessert . 

We had a great welcome , but not the right way of approaching. I asked him what is seasonal fruit but he is responding me i will give it to you complimentary. Who are you to offer me complimentary when i come to take a dining experience and giving me whole fruit in the table like a fruit basket. 

After he kept the bottle on the table of water where  i served my self.

I order for 2 blackbery mojito . Disgusting black berry syrup in mojito without a lime flavor in that presentation was disgusting , felt like a small kids did a trail mocktail. 

Then he place desser which we dint like or consume it might be we dint like the taste . 

Service was dam casual carrying the glass in the both hand and he is serving in our table . 

Even the waiter were carrying the tray but now this old guys in blazer outdoor were doing rubbish service . 

I asked for bill and he presented the bill he dint even ask how was the food and why u guys have not consumed it .

Moral of the story is 

Find young and energetic employees with positive mind set for the place to get the market value . 

At last 9 KWD was the bill i paid him 15 KWD . 

That was not a tips i paid for the complimentary fruit basket which provided in the table in a rude manner which cost 3 kwd  . 
 
And rest 3 kwd is for you to recharge your phone some internet pack and watch some guest satisfaction in restaurants vidio and gain some knowledge. 

Treat every human same . Doent matter we come in blazer or shirt . White or black . Dessert or lunch . 

Warmest regards, 
Rao

title: New Konkan Region Menu
text:
Had oppurtunity to try out the new menu at Asha's @ Bouleward.
Tried out Komdi Vade, thick coconut gravy chicken curry with Puri. This is really awesome and tasty.
Special mention to the chef for the freshly prepared Saffron Milk Cake, which is really wonderful.

Excellent hospitality by Mr.Thahir and Mr.Hussain who explained in detail on the new menu from Asha's team.

I recommend everyone to try this out.

title: First timers are always served the best
text:
I went with my husband for dinner. It was our first time there, and we made sure to inform them that we are not familiar with Indian food. It was a great experience. 
The waiters were coming and going just explaining the full menu for us giving example of taste so we can understand what does this taste like. Later we had our first appetizer, it was sort of Indian dumplings, I didn‚Äôt like it. But my husband ate 3 pieces ‚ò∫Ô∏è. Then cane the bread ( naan with garlic and cheese üßÄ) 
I can eat this every day and for every meal 
Then the main dish ohhhh laaa laaa
Chicken butter amazing but to heavy for me 
Chicken Masala the perfect dish 
WE WILL ORDER IT EVERY TIME WE VISIT
and last the chicken beryani also amazing
We are for sure visiting again soon

title: Best location of a great chain!
text:
We are regulars at this Asha's location because the kitchen is more consistent than other locations (very excellent v. excellent), and the staff know us well.  If you are in doubt about what to order, the waiters are frequently very helpful. But, the best recommendations come from the manager Renju.  When the special menu comes out, Renju can share with you what selections suit your taste.

We are lassi fans, Renju turned us on to Rose Jam Ice Tea.  On our most recent visits, Asha's has had special menus and we were delighted to tone down our spice level (we take five chilis without a tear) in order to enjoy some of the new flavors in their Dhani Korma and Rara Ghost.  

As for Renju, eat and be happy.

title: Very good Indian in Salmiya
text:
Real Indian food in this nice restaurant close to the marina 
Quick and discrete service , great dishes and reasonable prices.
So far best Indian food in Kuwait

title: Good Fodd
text: One can get good Indian veg & non-veg cuisine over here. It is good in terms of service, food quality & ambience. Location is excellent. It is good to visit with friends & families.

title: Overcrowded

title: Back again to Marina branch
text:
Back again to Marina branch

title: POOR ‚Äúpick-up‚Äù service at Shamiya
text:
I placed an order this morning (12 March) Via Deliveroo‚ÄôS NEW ‚Äúpick-up‚Äù service to Shamiya Coop Supermarket. I am a NEW customer and I ordered to enjoy the NEW vegan & meatless items. 
.
I ordered the beyond meat wrap and I received the ciabatta (mistake No 1)! Obviously, I found out about ‚Äúthis mistake‚Äù once I am back home. I called staff and requested a replacement; I drove back to the store and was greeted by the store manager and Varish (Nepali), the barista who prepared my order.  I returned the ciabatta and received the wrap.  Varish remained silent and seemed agitated. 
.
I ordered the NEW caramel mousse and it was out of stock. On my 1st arrival for pick up, I was informed and was given the choice of another item. I choose water. I paid (1,320 KD) for the vegan mousse, and I got one water bottle (600 fils) instead of 2, to compensate for the price. Varish was present and he remained silent. By the way, I found out about the price discrepancy (mistake No 2), once I am back home scrutinising the invoice. I could NOT go back, for the 2nd time, to collect the remaining water bottle. 
.
On the next day, I discovered ‚Äúmistake No 3‚Äù, by which I ordered the Perrier Peach but received Perrier Strawberry. At this point, I think it is about time to clear this messy issue & deliberate move of Vinesh to discourage NEW customers from coming again. I called the manager (Mr. Arthur), and requested to receive the missing water bottle and the Perrier Peach today; once and for all. I had to visit the store on the 13th of March, and to my surprise Mr. Arthur offered me the newly stocked Vegan Chocolate Caramel Mousse as a BONUS and I got my Perrier Peach as well. 
.
My conclusion, is that Vinesh, the barista, is either careless or is directing his anger towards customers. The whole Starbucks experience was a waste of my time and it was a big hassle going to complete my order, by visiting 3 times in two days. 
 .
SEE photos of the received wrong items and the ‚Äúthe invoice‚Äù
.

title: Strawberry Cr√®me Frappuccino¬Æ Blended Beverage
text:
I had the classic Strawberry Frappuccino with vanilla cr√®me on top for breakfast. I requested it, with an extra pur√©e and to be ‚Äúdouble blended‚Äù, to avoid chunky ice. The drink looked pretty marbled.  This is coffee-free and it would be a great choice for kids. After drinking it, I would say that it was more milky than fruity, with a pleasant tart flavour. It was nice but not very delicious. I would love to see more fruity drinks at Starbucks such as bananas. 

SEE photos.

title: Banoffee pot
text:
I had the newly added item of Banoffee pot, it is greek yogurt with cream, fresh bananas with caramel, with a base of graham crumbles drizzled with caramel and topped with chocolate curls. The flavour was smooth and everything was velvety. It was not too sweet. The size was great for 1 person. 

SEE photos

title: EXCELLENT FOOD FRESHLY COOKED
text: A great place for good quality great tasting moderately priced thai cuisine. The restaurant itself is basic but very clean andthe food is excellent. There seems to be just one person doing everything and so is nonstop working including dealing with takeaways. The food is of high consistent quality and would well recommend a visit.

title: This place is unsuspecting
text: This place is unsuspecting yet such good food. It‚Äôs not the ambiance, it‚Äôs the service and food. Amazing Thai food and good service! It‚Äôs one of those places you want to return. Good to sit in or take out.

title: Quaint Thai restaurant
text: This restaurant is in the bylanes so a bit difficult if you don‚Äôt know about it. The food is really good.  The place is small with limited seating due to the prevailing situation. We had the Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai Noodles, clear soup.. all of which was delicious

title: I love Sabaidee
text: I love all the food here, the taste is very good. Especially, when I compare to the price! If you find the beautiful place, taste good with the cheap price  in Kuwait I recommend Sabaidee restaurant. I love Thai food!!!!

title: A spot-on reminder of our years in Thailand
text:
We lived in Thailand before moving to Kuwait, and this is the first time we've had Thai food in almost a year (delivery, due to Covid).  Sabaidee was exactly like the food we ate every day in Bangkok (except, of course, no pork!). We ordered pad thai, pad see eu, drunken noodles, Hainanese chicken and rice, and three orders of sticky rice, plus som tam (papaya salad).  All were just exactly perfect and brought up visceral memories of our time in Thailand, in the best way.  The kids wanted extra orders of chicken and rice next time, and my husabnd wants to try their red curry.

Highly recommended!

title: Thank you
text:
Been here few days ago... 
I love it ... 
buffet can definitely be improved , there‚Äôs no many choices and no name tags for all the dishes ... Portions are quite small... Pastry chef could work on a taste of the desserts as they taste a bit plain... 
The main reason why I‚Äôm giving 5 stars is your staff. They are JUST AMAZING.... I came a bit late and they still accepted me me and my companion with a big big smile ... Especially lady Nirmala (if I remember her name well)... She‚Äôs just so attentive. I do pay attention to these things as I‚Äôm restaurant Manager myself. She was always around us trying to get our preferences. And she kept buffet open a bit longer so we don‚Äôt stay without our desserts. She‚Äôs such a gem! 
I‚Äôll definitely come back. Price is as well very good. 
Thank you all!

title: Thumbs up BBQ night
text: Once temperature starts to go down in Kuwait, Al Bustan restaurant at the Radisson Blu hotel  has a BBQ night every Wednesday with live band. The place has a modern look with fresh bright colours and comfy circular sofas.The food variety was excellent and the buffet for salads and deserts are rich, generous and  appealing to the eyes. The BBQ stations are outdoor including sections for all kind of meats, chicken and wide selection of sea food & fish's. Additionally they have Chicken shawarma, noodles station, asian food, ribs, ice-cream etc... The service as well was excellent despite being crowded and busy. At the time of the review the  restaurant charges KD 17,- per person excluding drinks a very reasonable price taking into considerations the quality and varieties offered. Overall highly recommended and if its humid select a table inside

title: Dinner
text: Its an old saying "Dinner is better when we eat to gether" its friends get to gether and it was a life time memory at Radisson Blu. The food omg it was super delicious and the way they  treated and served to us that's so lovely . especially the crew Nijum,Alysa,Sujith & Binu you guys stewardship was out standing . The ambience was excellent ,the chef who made the delicious grills .. Just waw its still mouth watering . Your service  and food  its highly recommended. Much appreciation   for Binu & Team. Thanks for the marvelous memory.

title: Barbeque night at Al Bustan
text: Being new to Kuwait, my friends and I decided to visit the Al Bustan restaurant in the Radisson Blu hotel. We were seated at an outside table close to a waterfall. It was so calming with great ambience. There was such a huge variety that we could not decide on what to eat. The roasts were cooked to perfection and the meats were soft like butter. The many salads and starters were so interesting that I didn't know which to try. The Sushi was fresh and deliciously prepared. There was an extensive range of desserts. This was truly a feast. Whether it's for business, pleasure or a family dinner. It was truly amazing and to top it off the chef always came around checking to see if everything was in order. I will definitely be visiting this restaurant again and will recommend it as it as a variety which caters to most tastes.

title: Radison Blue Hotel

This place is spectacular,  we came here on wednsday(Barbecue Night) the meeat is fresh, huge variety of meat and chicken, they even have turkey and live sheesh shawarma. The salad bar is humongous  , all fresh and . I. Huge cariety of fruits and de. 

I rate this place 9/10
The serbice speed can pick up a bit 
crunchy

title: Big portions, large ribs
text:
Chilli's at Al Noor Mall in Madinah was an interesting find for us, because as a visitor to Madinah, you tend to stick to whatever is on offer in and around the Prophet's mosque. If you like to venture out a bit, and have a hankering of ribs, I would recommend this place.
My wife had the Classic Sirloin with Grilled Avocado steak, my son had a normal pasta, daughter Quesadilla Explosion chicken salad, while I had the full-rack BBQ Beef Ribs. The portions were big, with the steak cooked to my wife's liking - medium rare. The salad and the pasta were ‚ÄúOK‚Äù, according to my two teens, so nothing to shout about. 
My full-rack, however, was the biggest I have had so far in KSA ‚Äì as I mentioned before, I was on a quest to try all the ribs from all the popular chains in KSA. Just as Chilli‚Äôs described it, the full rack was moist and falling off the bone, with a nice smoky BBQ tastes which was not too sweet and not too savoury. It was not the best tasting of ribs I had, but definitely the biggest and was good enough for me. 
I have not tried Chilli‚Äôs ribs at its other branches ‚Äì there is one in Jubail where I am based ‚Äì so I hope the quality is the same.
One thing that would have made our dining experience even better if Chilli‚Äôs had offered a pitcher of the cocktails, but I guess you may prefer individual choices. A bottom-less soda would be great as well.
Share with me your ribs/steak experience.

title: Disappointing Experience at Al Baik, Madinah
text:
I apologize for the oversight in my previous response. Here's the revised correction, retaining all the ideas and statements from your original text:

My visit to "Al Baik" in Madinah was far from what I expected. The order process at the cashier was chaotic and noisy, making it difficult to communicate. I ordered two Shrimp Sandwiches without being informed of the additional wait time they required. The process of collecting the order was disorganized, with customers pushing aggressively to give their receipts to the staff. I experienced a significant delay with my order, ticket number 190 from 20.12.2023, while orders like number 211 were served before me. The workers' shouting and machine noise made the 20-minute wait, which is lengthy for fast food, even more challenging. Meanwhile, the taxi I had waiting added to the urgency, as the taximeter was running.

The quality and size of the Shrimp Sandwich were even more disappointing. The sandwich was tiny, barely 1.5 bites, and for the price of 21 SAR (about 5 euros), I expected more, especially considering that in Switzerland, I could get a larger, better sandwich from a cleaner store for the same amount.

Additionally, I was surprised to learn from my credit card statement that Al Baik is part of Carrefour. I would have appreciated more transparency from Al Baik about this affiliation.

title: They try hard‚Ä¶ But if you are a pizza fan, just walk on
text:
For a snack when faux-pizza will do, then this is the place for you. As everywhere in Riyadh there are two entrances: one for singles (which means men only), and another labelled the 'family section.' Take-out is available. 

The menus are adequately illustrated so that even if you know no Arabic you will get what you ordered. It is cheap. You can get an 8 inch pizza and a soda for about $5.50. There are options for original crust, thin crust, and the one with cheese wrapped into the margin. But, really, the food product is only a distant relative from what you expected from the chain-label: Pizza Hut. For all that, you are getting the best that is available in Riyadh. So, eat up, don't complain, and walk out from your snack time with your SAR reserves still intact

title: Awful excuse for an Indian restaurant
text:
I took my dad here while he was visiting and we regretted every minute of it. The location is great and the outside makes you think the interior will be just as good - but it's dark and cramped. 

The service was decent and the staff friendly, but the quality of the food was anything but edible. There was no flavor in anything and everything was creamy and greasy. We left feeling heavy and unsatisfied. Never again!

title: Family Lunch
text: We went for lunch during lunch time and ordered from lunch-offer menu. The food was delicious, with proper heat. The lunch-offer charges are raised. The drinks are refillable. The lunch offer consists of 2 opening dishes and a main dish. For the opening dish, you have 2 choices between soup and light appetizers like chicken wings, chicken quesadilla and other cousins. I usually prefer barbecue chicken wings. The staff were nice and helpful. My advice to you, don't go on Fridays unless you have reservation as it is very occupied during the weekend.

It stands out as one of Riyadh's finest Lebanese restaurants, known for its top-quality cuisine. The food is simply exceptional, complemented by a delightful ambiance and impeccable service.

It's an ideal choice for gatherings or when you want to impress someone with a memorable dining experience. While it may not be the most budget-friendly option, the quality of the food more than justifies the cost.

title: Very poor service
text:
I visited this restaurant on 24th June 2021 and was subjected to very poor service. We were riding to Alkhor from Doha, and upon reaching the restaurant it took almost 25 to 30 minutes for the waiter to come and give us the menu, and upon presenting the menu he bluntly mentioned that any BBQ item would take more than 1 hour to prepare, which was very pathetic. Overall, the restaurant was not so crowded but still it was very amusing as to why they weren‚Äôt able to deliver a good service. I, personally disagree of this being restaurant being on the top 10 as it was one of my worst experiences in a restaurant in Qatar. 
PS - it is worth mentioning that I‚Äôve visited the al-Nasr branch of the same restaurant and it was top class.

title: The Best Eat-All-You-Can Resto
text:
It's Christmas Season, so like any other days that we wanted to eat all we can, Shanghai Garden in City Center Mall is our go to. As always the restaurant never fail us . The options on the buffet section is numerously good. We always have an appetite to have a hot pot. Sushi section and those of fried and steamed dumplings are superb, as always. Also one of our favorite is the buchi or sesame balls (or as i ordered it when I was in China - "jiandui") it's always prepared in perfection. Thumbs up to the chef preparing it and to those cooking and preparing other foods, as well all those waiters and waitresses.

Can't wait to be back there and have a treat, as usual! ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Regular Customer
text:
I'm a regular customer of Shanghai Garden CC Branch. And to be honest I don't know if that is a good thing or not. For sure my face is familiar to most of the waiting staff there (well anyway, maybe) and I feel sad that amongst the review I wrote for this establishment this is the lowest rate I've given. 

Even though the supervisor and the staffs are apologetic to what happened, I feel that it's worth mentioning to raise some awareness also in behalf of all other customers.

Here's what happened - so me and my friend were eating buffet with hotpot, so while in just half of the hotpot we go get our drinks and to our surprise when we get back to our table it was cleared already. Most of the time, we always taken vegetables and meats for the hotpot twice so imagine this is just the first one and we're just half way down eating. It's really, really bad experience. And take note, this is not the first time it happen. The first one, since it's first so you just somewhat let it pass. So now for sure, you understand why I need to make a review about it. Though they've been apologetic about it. But I guess somebody should do something about it to prevent it from happening again.

title: Very Lukewarm Food!
text: I visited this restaurant recently and had high expectations but was disappointed.  Although they had a wide variety of food on display, the food was very lukewarm. I complained about it to the waiter and she just smiled and said ok. I didn‚Äôt enjoy the food at all. They also used plastic cups which had seen better days therefore I will not be returning in future!

title: Best lamb chops in Doha
text:
This restaurant is in Al Wakra, just south of Doha, on the main road.

A lot of people will order by phone and get their take-away, but that would be missing the point.

The kilo of lamb chops is served with a baked bread crust, that keeps the heat and moisture inside.

The kilo dishes are much better served and smoking hot than individual dishes. Mixed grills are good, but not in the same league as lamb chops.

Appetizers are also very good, with their warm puffy bread.

This is the best lamb chop destination in the <insert hyperbole>

The staff is supremely welcoming and nice, the toilets are forgettable (otherwise it would be 5 dots).

title: Don't ask for spicy at all
text:
Our visit last night was to Souq Al Wakrah, started in Fish Market or a group of 4 restaurants in 1 area where you can select your seafood, then they will take care for the rest. We selected Al Wakrah Popular Fish Restaurant and we never regret.
Selected 2 big Shiri fish, 1/2 kg medium shrimps. All grilled as well as a plate of rice.
What a big surprise..... we asked for medium spicy, but what we get was very high spicy. So, the consideration of the severity vary from a person to other. Tasty fish, good price, huge amount of food, friendly staff and nice seating area.
Everything were perfect. But don't forget not to ask for spicy food at all.

title: Not at all upto expectation!!

title: Good But Not the Best
text:
The restaurant is located in Souq Al-Wakrah by the sea. The place had both outdoor and indoor (air conditioned) tables which is great for all weather conditions.
The staff were very friendly and offered good servicing. The restaurant serves Indian cuisine dishes, which is one of my favorites. However, the quality of the served food could have been much better. Nevertheless, the pricing was convenient given the entire experience.

title: One of the best Indian meals in Qatar
text:
My wife and spent a lazy afternoon wandering the Old Souq in Al Wakra and decided to have dinner somewhere in the area to end the day.  Most of the restaurants in the OS are located along the beach, called Sea Side.  We had a look at the various venues and menus and settled on Barahat because we are fans of Indian cuisine.  Our experience was outstanding. 

We sat outside on the terrace.  It was a little cool this time of year, but pleasant.  They don't have outside heaters or blankets.  The latter would be a good idea to have on hand.  The service was excellent -- the waitress was knowledgable and able to explain everything we asked about, very polite and attentive, and always eager to help with any need.  We ordered the butter chicken and the prawn tikka masala curries, along with garlic naan bread and raita.  They served poppadams with a dipping sauce as complementary items.  They also gave us a taste of a new item for the drink menu, a kind of lassi or shake made with pomegranate.  Very good.  

In fact, every dish was outstanding.  The shrimp and chicken were tender and properly cooked, the gravies were thick and masterfully spiced, and the naan bread was among the best we have had in Doha.  We often find it is too dry in many restaurants.  Here it was buttery and had just the right amount of garlic.  The raita was also thick and luxurious, very refreshing due to the grated cucumber.  I asked for additional spices because my wife prefers milder food.  The waitress brought me three condiments -- a bottle of hot sauce, Kashimiri chilli powder, and a third that featured cracked black pepper and something else I could not identify.  All good and a nice spectrum of heat options. We had lemon-mint drinks with our meal.  

One of the owners (we think) stopped by our table near the end of the meal to thank us for our patronage and ask about our experience.  He was very nice and informed us that they are developing new dishes and to please return to try them.  We certainly will!

The total for our bill was 142 QAR.  A good deal for a great meal.

title: Old Wakrah Souq
text:
After a good walk in Old Wakrah Souq, stopped at Barahat Al Wakrah restaurant for dinner. Nice interior ambiance but we decided to sit outdoor facing the sea. Friendly staff and service. Our food was fattoush salad, mixed grill, hot freshly baked bread and lemon juice with mint. All were perfect with clear Indian spices taste. Good price and amazing time. 
Thank you Barahat Al Wakrah staff.

title: Perfect Indian Restaurant in Souq Al Wakra
text: Perfect Indian Restaurant, has sufficient number of vegetarian dishes too. Loved the food and it's taste. Hospitality of staff is very good. Must visit.

title: Nice setting, real shame about the food and service
text:
Great location in Al-Wakrah and a lovely hotel and courtyard. That's about the only good part.

Service is woeful. No one comes to attend, or check in after food arrives. Food was rubbish. We ordered calamari starter. Overcooked giant rings in layers of thick batter. Like trying to chew a mini car tyre. Embarrassing. Chicken/rice main dish was 5/10 at best. Chicken was dry and the rice pretty tasteless. But edible at least.

Duty manager declined to call her manager, as we wanted to give direct feedback. Only after prompting did she waive the calamari bill.

Best to avoid.

text:

title: Exceptional food, great service, and a beautiful setting make it a place worth visiting again and again.
text: This elegant restaurant brings a touch of the Far East to Qatar with its sophisticated ambiance and diverse menu. The restaurant's layout offers a mix of intimate booths and open seating, perfect for both romantic dinners and group gatherings. The menu is a delightful exploration of Asian cuisine, featuring a range of dishes from various regions. We started with the crispy spring rolls and dim sum, which were bursting with flavor and expertly crafted. For the main course, the Peking duck was a standout ‚Äì perfectly crispy with tender, flavorful meat, served with all the traditional accompaniments. The dessert menu was equally impressive, offering a selection of both traditional and contemporary options. The mango sticky rice was a refreshing end to our meal, balancing sweetness and texture beautifully.

title: Recommended
text:
Super interior and guest welcome 
Friendly staff and delicious food.
The only comment I can give is menu to small  for Chinese cuisine .

title: A fantastic choice for anyone looking to enjoy authentic Italian cuisine in Qatar. Highly recommended!
text: I had an amazing dining experience here.The restaurant has a cozy and inviting atmosphere, perfect for any occasion. The food was outstanding. We started with the Bruschetta al Pomodoro and Burrata, both of which were fresh and delicious. For the main course, I had the Osso Buco, which was tender and flavorful, while my friend enjoyed the Tagliatelle al Tartufo, a rich and creamy truffle pasta. We ended our meal with the Tiramisu and Panna Cotta, both perfect endings to a wonderful meal. The wine selection was also impressive, with a great variety of Italian wines to choose from.

title: A brunch at Sugar & Spice - Aspire Park - Doha
text:
This place is a hidden gem at Aspire park - Doha , offering signature plates for breakfast, lunch , and dinner with wide variety of fresh beverages. 
The staff are very friendly, welcoming and attentive, add to that the magnificent interior, where every spot is beautiful to take photos for instagram , the details of the interior with the staff uniform give you a refreshing vibe.
The food is freshly prepared, and the beverages are absolutely delicious.
you can easily find a parking for your car at Aspire park parking lot as it‚Äôs few meters away of the place.
Bathrooms are super clean , 5 star quality.

title: A fairy Tale Haven
text: It‚Äôs unbelievably beautiful has a 80s English country homes vybe which I looooooved . The food was extremely delicious, veggie tacos blew me , Hostess Janet was very welcoming and the two gentlemen who assisted with food orders were very good at it . Will definitely come back .

title: Charming Restaurant Near Aspire Park
text:
The restaurant is very charming and cozy. They have a good variety of breakfast, lunch and dessert options. The servers are very attentive here and as soon as a plate or drink is finished there are multiple people that will rush to assist and clear the table.

We tried a croque madame and the spicy shakshuka and felt both were ok. Both our drinks were very nice with our Pina colada and Spanish latte. The restaurant is the attraction here with some very nice farmhouse chic decor.

The restaurant is located nearby many attractions in the area like Villagio Mall, Aspire Park, the Torch Tower, 3-2-1 Museum, Khalifa Stadium, and the Aspire Dome. There is plenty of parking near the restaurant and the closest metro is Al Azizyah which is about a 15 minute walk away.

title: Exceptional Kindness and Professionalism at Loleya Caf√©
text: The team at Loleya Caf√©, especially Main, consistently stands out with her kindness, making every visit a pleasure. Polite, professional, and always ready with a smile, they provides exceptional service and a quality atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a cozy caf√© with stellar service provided by a wonderful team!

title: Always Exceptional !
text: I work regularly from Loleya, and I must say the service is always impeccable !! Main is always cheerful, happy and welcoming. Nadia is also very  welcoming and accommodating. The service is great from tea selection, coffee, to special treats. I feel comfortable working from here. Having an outdoor area is ideal in this great sunny weather. They have different table sizes that also have a sense of privacy and that makes it perfect for small meetings to friendly catchups. I wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else to work in Place Vendome. Thank you for your continuous warm welcome and for the beautiful exceptional service.

title: Visited for business lunch, disappointed with the food selection
text:
Visited The Restaurant @The Chedi for Business Lunch.
Great welcome by Julia
Ordered  the chilled mezze followed by the shish tawook and ended with the ice cream.
The basics were wrong, the hummus was bitter and not creamy. The moutabel nothing to write home about and we got a bowl full of pickled vegetables. It looks like the food had to fit the crockery, loads of pickles to fill the bowl. The Arabic bread was served cold.
The main course included five small pieces of flavourless chicken with more bitter hummus on the side.
The best part was the ice cream

title: Best Saturday brunch
text:
I went to the Saturday brunch of the restaurant at The Chedi Katara and we enjoyed it a lot. There's a good variety of delicious international food. I liked the sushi, the meats and desserts a lot. We where welcomed by Mariaelisa the hostess, who was very attentive and giving us the best customer service at us and all around the restaurant. And after the food we enjoyed at the pool which was relaxing and necessary. 
Thank you for the experience.

title: 4 happy girlies!!!
text: For an aesthetically pleasing venue, the hotel checks all the boxes. From the entrance to "The Restuarant" you are wowed but the chic elegant simplistic design. Entering "the Restuarant you are welcomed by smiles and an extensive buffet. From sushi, to Mexican, mix grills, salad and a variety of hot meals you really don't know where to start as it all looks amazing. Let me not start with dessert, woooowww talk about a selection! pastries, baklava, pies, tarts and an ice cream bar etc., if you have a sweet tooth like I do then this will be the highlight of the day. My only disappointment was the bitter chocolate used for the chocolate fountain. Hanas who was attending to us was so insightful and such a delight, from promoting future events to offering items we didn't notice, we really enjoyed the 5-star treatment from him.  After stuffing out faces we enjoyed the rest of the day at the pool. The cabanas are clean and well-kept with access to unlimited water and clean towels it was bliss. We ended the day with shisha by the pool as we watched the sunset.

title: CHEDI
text: Nice brunch, lots of options from around the world, the homemade gelato is a must. The venue is lovely and bright with a view on pool and beach.

title: Great food, exceptional service!
text: Had a birthday lunch here and it was indeed an amazing experience. Food is great and the ambiance and location is so relaxing. Special mention to Reena, Danis, William and Febry for providing excellent service. This whole experience went above and beyond our expectation!

title: 5 STAR EXPERIENCE
text: Perfect location for distressing. 5 star for the food, service and most especially to the staff. Thanks to William, Danis, Reena and Febry. Such a great experience and we'll definitely comeback.

text:

Also, we received an excellent service from Mr  Hatem who served my birthday cake and Mr Madhou who also looked after us. The valet Mr Satnam was also amazing. Thank you!

title: BTS Jung Kook was here!
text: I have always wanted to go to La Marsa ever since Jung Kook of BTS dined in this place and what better way to go when it‚Äôs their seafood night and celebrate my friend‚Äôs birthday. We appreciate the service of Hatem and Madhou for they‚Äôre very helpful in assisting us and for giving the complimentary birthday desserts with Dedication I wished he sang Happy Birthday as well like in all other restaurants but they were busy so maybe next time. The menu is delectable though there‚Äôs no oysters  and sushi available but I enjoyed the scallops and huge mussels. Their washroom locked must be checked as some of the cubicles don‚Äôt get locked.

title: Beautiful restaurant/location, beautiful/tasteful/healthy cuisine
text:
For me one of the best assets of Qatar is the international restaurant offer, as international cuisine helps travel in my opinion

So when I read about Hellas, I was excited to discover Greek cuisine I had heard so much about (known to be one of the healthiest in the world, even the healthiest according to many)

I definitely got that, with excellent food, that looked good, tasted good, felt good

But I got even more, with a truly beautiful restaurant, that made me really feel like I was traveling to Greece

And also a very friendly staff

I enjoyed it so much that I ordered more than I usually do, having pumpkin soup (goat cheese, coriander oil, sourdough bread), Greek salad (tomato, cucumber, feta mousse, onion, green peppers, capers, olive oil, oregano), spanakopita (home made filo pastry, spinach, feta mouse, dill oil), risotto (shrimps, pumpkin, white truffle oil)... what a feast!

And the location in Katara is ideal for people coming by car, as it's very near the outdoor parking

Highly recommended! üòã

title: Tasty Greek Food in Katara
text:
The staff were very welcoming when we arrived and provided prompt service initially. The Santorini salad and zucchini tempura we started with were excellent and the portions were fair. The mousakas was well prepared and very flavourful.

We found issues getting our bill at the end of our meal but it wasn't a big deal. We had asked for it a couple of times but it wasn't clear if we had to go up to the counter and pay or if the bill would come to us.

Hellas has a nice patio and overlooks Katara Cultural Village's beach/promenade. The closest metro is Al Qassar but Katara isn't too far away either if you want to walk around the area.

title: Lovely Greek restaurant
text:
We had a wonderful dinner at Hellas. Zucchini tempura, tzatziki so fresh and tasty, My husband had the eggplant moussaka which was amazing, 

Great ambiance, you feel as if you were in Mykonos or Santorini, tables, chairs, paintings all made the difference. Just across the road from the beach at the end of Katara Village, a great find, Service was perfect. Very clean.

title: Best Greek restaurant in Doha
text: Exquisite Food experience.  We went in a group and with a Greek Chef, and he confirmed my opinion as this is the best Greek food in Doha. Typical homemade food, delicious and extremely well made. The manager is extremely kind and he knows how to recommend your meals so you can have the best out of Greece,  and the way he treats clients. I guarantee you won't forget it.

title: A place to chill
text:
I had been to Hellas a few times before and always had a positive experience. 
A great place to chill and enjoy the food. 
I would say it is a safe place to take your friends. It is very unlikely your friends would look down your choice.

title: Great food
text: The food is great and the food serves on time. We had a great time eating and we appreciate Mr. Alvin & Mr. Emelia who provide good service and very accommodating.

title: The Max's Experience!
text: We had a great time! The food was delicious and the staff, especially Chirsty, was very kind and accommodating. Would definitely visit again !

title: Big disaapointment
text:
What a very unpleasant experience. 
I came bringing a gift card from a supplier's opening. I told the sales staff to check to check if the gift card is okey. She said it is okey but there is no change and you have to finish the whole amount,  so I said no problem will do that. 
After eating I asked for the bill and I gave her the gift card. She came back and told me mam sorry we can't accept the gift card because it is expired. 
OmG! That is why I told her to check first right? 
She did apologize  and gave a discount however there is no need for all of this if she told me from the beginning by checking properly. I am eating in this restaurant only for the gift card. Really. What a disappointment.

title: Best tofu, rock melon drinks, and breakfast meal experience
text: Karen is very welcoming and nice. She cared for us well when we had breakfast at Maxxs. I recommend rock melon drinks and tofu sisig.

title: Superb Dining Experience
text:
We usually come here 2-3x a week since this is the place where we dine after work. From the entrance, you will feel the warm welcome vibes till they have given your table. The food has a wide selection, but we would normally order sinigang na baka because its taste gives you a feeling being home.
Kudos to Al Sadd Team. :)

Neilson & Lovel Parinas

title: Loved our meal at Bandar Aden
text:
We were in Doha for one night during a layover on our way home from Africa.  We stopped in Doha a few weeks prior when we began our trip so this was our second meal in Qatar.

I did a lot of research looking for a restaurant that we wouldn't be able to find at home and I saw many great reviews for Bandar Aden.  We walked over from our hotel and found it easily via Google Maps and some well placed signs.  It was 95F at 8pm and the a/c felt great as we entered the restaurant.  It wasn't full when we arrived but got increasingly busy as the night wore on and by 9:30pm there was a line waiting for tables.  You have the option of sitting at a table or in in a carpeted room on the floor with cushions.

We weren't familiar with Yemeni cuisine so our waiter gave us his recommendations and shared a menu that had photos of the popular dishes.  We started with a clear broth soup and 4 of us shared platters of Lamb Mandi, Chicken Buried and a pot of beef with tomato, served with fresh hot bread.  The lamb and chicken dishes came with seasoned rice.  It was all wonderful but the lamb stole the show.  We had never had lamb so tender!  The beef and chicken dishes were also delicious.  We stayed at our table for nearly 2 hours trying to finish because it was so good! 

The Corniche is 5 minutes away and I recommend taking a walk over after dinner.  The views are beautiful and the walk after a heavy meal felt great.

Believe the good reviews.

title: Good
text: This is a busy spot, we went 2 times and the 2nd time it was different, we ate half the zabein rice which is what sells the most and asked for a take away , but to my shock when i got home the take away was different which is irritating cause i was looking forward to the lamb

title: Fantastic. Value and quality.
text:
What a find.

Fantastic meal. Delicious. And lots of it.

We‚Äôll worth dropping by and availing yourself of a fine meal. 

Probably the best value for money if any trip I‚Äôve done.

title: Great local food here.
text:
Make sure if you want somethin local here is the place to be, just follow the crowd, its got eveything you need and want, the place was packed and lots of ppl sitting outside luckliy we got a spot all the way in the back room.

Ordered some bbq chicken with rice pilaf, curry pot, freshly baked naanbread, and local salsa ! The food was great and friendly service as well cheap eats for sure‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Thank you.

title: Excellent traditional food
text: A nice surprise regarding traditional food.  Fresh Arabic bread, lamb, grilled fish rice, chicken, vegetables, yogurt! The portions are huge and the food is really tasty.

title: Super cheap and tasty
text: Restaurant is located in a thoroughfare as you walk up the main pedestrian street of the Souq  Waqif from the corniche end, turning left just before the crossroads with the Damascus restaurant on your left. Tables turn over very quickly so you generally won‚Äôt wait long. Simple menu of freshly grilled meets and Arabic dudes served with delicious hot pide bread fresh from the oven outside the kitchen. Very basic food, cooked and served quickly at unbelievably value. Worth searching out for an authentic, cheap Souq dinner.

title: Worst Restaurant in Doha..
text: Worst restaurant in Qatar, very rude staff, dead cold food,worst customer service, guy on till never bother to look always on phone watching videos

title: Great Kebabs
text: A really earthy restaurant in a side street. Order and pay, and someone will find a table and then the food arrives. The chicken and lamb kebabs served on flatbread were really tasty. A good place for a family dinner.

title: Rotten food
text: You should be more responsible regarding the food you serve. Last Saturday I had diner at Damasca One and had some lamb kibbe. The next day I spent the whole day flying with Qatar Airways in the toilet defecating every hour due the the rotten kibe. Al Thani family should make a surprise visit. (or better shut down)

title: Great Syrian cruising experience
text: The food was fantastic and service are very good. Staff are friendly and professional. Place was clean and very artistic. Love the environment and love to try different recipe. 1st time try Camel meat. Very authentic crushing.

text: Best restaurant ever in Doha , a truly recommend if you want a local food that have good pepper, attendant , in the souq, the lemon mint is the drink and the Kabsa was divine !

title: Souq Waqif Branch
text:
I visited Souq Waqif where you can smell the real taste of Qatar, walking between spice shops and restaurants. A viral area always especially in winter when weather permit outer walking and seating.
Little Sailor Seafood is a great experience in here. Many steps, start to choose your fish, the way they cook, adds on, and finally serving it to you.
Our choice was in Al Bahar Signature Fish, Calamari rings as well as soft drinks.  Good service but a bit slow, tasty food and fine price.

title: The Best Kunafa in Doha
text:
The best Kunafa and Baklavas in town. Their stuff sells like hot cakes and if you'd get a seat outside their restaurant, you'd be lucky.
You can't leave the Souk without grabbing some of their stuff. The mixed Kunafa and Baklavas were a hit, so much so that I even got them home. The staff will pack them accordingly, if you wish to carry them.
Love this place.

title: The best sweets ever
text: Definitely the best sweets in Doha . Very tasty coffee ne absolutely great oriental sweets. Must visit and must try. The only thing it is always full. Take your time and patience, because locals don‚Äôt know the word ‚Äûwait‚Äù

title: Recommended place to visit, whether you go with family, friends, or your loved one. Don't missed to visit this place.
text: I went for Kunafa, It is so delicious, I love it so much :) I love the location and the ambience as well. And so man various sweet I can find in this place.

title: Best knafeh
text: Popular dessert spot with Knafeh (15 QAR).  Available to eat outside or for take away.  Popular with the locals.  Knafeh here is absolutely amazing and not to be missed.  Located right behind the gold thumb.

title: Best in Doha
text: Excellent service and quality.   The bakery had a line around it with good reason. The quality selection and staff are all outstanding

title: Nice location
text: Good Turkish food at a busy restaurant. Usual traditional specialities on offer. Kebabs and pide were very good. Outside seating in a nice location on the edge of the souk. Service OK, but could be better and more attentive.

title: Bod indian restaurant
text: Worst experience in a restaurant.  Pathetic service, no welcome drink or pappadams. Gulab jamuns are the worst I have ever had.

title: Avoid for the terrible attitude
text: Loved the vibe. Located almost in the centre of the Souk, this place is buzzing. Undoubtedly the outside seating is grabbed like hot cakes and one might end up waiting for a table. Coming to food, we ordered a couple of pizzas and a salad. The portion size is generous and was decently flavoured , except for the fact that the most important ingredient, salt was missing. Now coming to the worst part, the staff. Their hospitality and mannerisms were amongst the worst that I have ever seen. Think there was a lady called Jennifer, who really needs some basic training. Only average staff out there was an Asian gentleman. Avoidable place, as I'd get better pizzas with better hospitality elsewhere.

title: Tasty and affordable
text: Tasty food that is affordable as well. I got their chicken wrap for breakfast and I was surprised with how big the portion was. Great service as well.

title: Abdul you were very helpful thank you
text: Pizza and boom burger and very good but abduls service is what led me to this review. Very kind to my daughter also he was looking after so many tables at a quick pace and so friendly to all

title: OK food
text: The food is OK but the female staff act as if it's too much of a hassle to have to serve you. The male staff were friendlier. Prices are decent for the area.

title: Snacks!!!
text: Food is very nice and the service was great! Price is cheap but the quality of the food was Superb. And I would like to say thank you to the person who assisted us while we are outside (I forgot his name sorry) he was very accommodating. And also Thank you to Ms. Jhean for assisting and giving us a super duper service! Will definitely come back again.üôèüèª

title: Tasty and affordable
text:
We stumble on this restaurant while exploring the souk. It looked busy with the locals. Always a good sign!
Multiple options from Lebanese,turkish ,persian and Indian
I had the chicken briani, and it was yummy. My husband and son had a persian and Turkish food
It came with rice. 
The portions were quite large, and in hindsight we probably  we could have shared a dish among two of us.
The staff were friendly . Food and service was good. Not a fine dining restaurant,  but it's perfectly OK for a nice affordable meal

title: Best Indian food in Qatar!!!
text:
Located in the heart of the Souk, head here for the most authentic Indian food you could wish for. We had a flaky parantha, Daal Makhani and malai chicken.

As Indians we know our cuisine but this was absolutely outstanding. We called for the chef to heap praise on him - Allaudin Khan is trained in India's best restaurants.

Prices are very reasonable. Get served by Momodo and you will have truly lucked out. What a cheerful and super helpful waiter he is. Hope he goes far.

title: Nice restaurant with very good service and food
text: Nice restaurant, good atmosphere, fabulous food and very good service. Very kind staff. good prices. The curry and vegetarian food is very good, the dessert delicious. Very well located at the entrance to the Souq, and it is also very spacious and pleasant.

title: Good Food
text:
Good food and service here.  Big portions and plenty of bread provided while waiting.Obviously fab location in heart of Souq Waqif.
Would happily return.

title: Bad experience and Poor service at the Village souq waqif restaurant
text:
I went The Village  souq waqif  with my kids.
The service was poor. When placing the order, they did not even ask if i wanted any starters or any drinks.  The zaafaran rice was without butter or any type of oil, it was really dry and kids could not digest it. chicken was cooked with excessive dose of Lemon. R‚Äù
Above all, with a weather of 40 degree celcius, there was no AC . I highlighted this to the waiter but no action has been taken. The indoor area of the restaurant was very hot it was very very uncomfortable to  in a hot weather. While payment I highlighted these points, they were saying like : AC can not cool all the areas then they said our compressor is broken.
Poor quality Poor services very disappointing. 
I do not recommend.

title: Limited Menu and Poor Service
text:
I‚Äôve visited Parisa a few times over the years and have always been delighted with the food, but on this occasion was disappointed to find a much more limited menu available. The aubergine dip was fantastic, as always, but every other dish was quite underwhelming. 
The service was fast - a little bit too fast, in fact. We were still eating our starters when the main dishes arrived and were essentially rushed to finish this course to make room for the extra plates. This left for quite an uncomfortable dining experience and one which I won‚Äôt be seeking again in a hurry.

title: Lunch in the Souk Waqif
text: Amazing interior decor,this was reason enough to go inside.Staff were excellent,communication not a problem(we are english speakers) and the Arabic food was delicious, especially the olives, in addition I had a salad and meatballs. No alcohol but since it was lunch I had watermelon juice instead

title: Wonderful Evening
text: We made reservations to enjoy a wonderful dinner. We were greeted and seated promptly, with servers paying full attention to us even though the place was busy. We ordered three dishes, the serving size was pretty good. All three dishes tasted great, with authentic flavors and appearance. The restaurant is well maintained and very picturesque. Nice place to enjoy traditional meal.

title: Deliciously simple‚Ä¶
text: Very unassuming from the street, but one you walk down the long hallway this places seems magical. The staff is very friendly.  The service is pretty quick. The portion sizes are ample - I was too full from lunch so couldn‚Äôt eat everything they offered. There was no alcohol on the menu, so I got a mocktail which was very good.  If you‚Äôre wondering through the Souq Wastif and looking for a good meal, definitely give this a try.

title: Charming Dining at Parisa, Souq Waqif
text: Parisa at Souq Waqif is such a delightful spot! The Persian decor is absolutely stunning, with its vibrant colors and intricate details‚Äîit feels like you‚Äôre dining in a palace. The food? Simply delicious! From the tender kebabs to the flavorful rice, every dish is packed with authentic taste. The staff are warm and attentive, making sure you‚Äôre well taken care of. Plus, the atmosphere is so cozy and charming, perfect for a relaxed evening out in the heart of Doha. Definitely a must-visit!

title: Amazing breakfast experince
text:
Been in Kube restaurant, Wyndham west bay-Doha, was on of  best things I've been done lately.
.Delicious food with much varities& professional helpful staff.
Compared to the price, no other place can give the same joy and satisfaction
Thanks to all who were there in service, and best wishes. Highly recommended to try.

title: Highly recommended this hotel,accessible to restaurants,shops,gym,and transport.

title: Around the Table in Doha
text: It‚Äôs good to confirm that Carluccio‚Äôs at The Pearl still not losing its touch when it comes to Italian dining scene, even with the burgeoning competitions most specifically in The Pearl area. Our food for that night were mostly delish especially the truffle pizza as well as the seafood pasta that were recommended by their staff named Hazel. We noticed that Hazel was almost singlehandedly worked the whole place which was admirable and I am compelled to commend her work ethics. A repeat visit is a must most certainly during autumn season for sure.

title: Very Authentic Food
text: Been there with the family and the food was fantastic. Very authentic Arabic dishes with  selections of mutton, Chicken and Fish. I recommend going for their signature MADFOON and Mandi rice, probably the best dish of its kind in whole UAE. Then you can seal it off with a freshly baked cheese or cream Kunafeh. Very good service and genuinely courteous staff. Fair price for the quality of the food and service.

title: Best Mandi in RAK
text: This hospitable place has some of the best ‚ÄúMandi‚Äù Which is a traditional slow roasted chicken or lamb serve with rice and chili sauce which is some of the best in the country. The place is very unassuming but believe me that the staff will make you very comfortable and the ambience tries to imitate a traditional tent the way used to be many years ago. We had the lamb muqalqal with rice which was outstanding and a single dish was more than enough for two. For dessert we loved the warm Kunafa with Pistachio and traditional Arabic coffee. Very reasonably priced as well. We were supposed as to how good the food was and the most welcoming staff anywhere.

title: Al Marjan - level of professionalism and hospitality
text:
During my recent visit to Al Marjan, I was thoroughly impressed by the exceptional service provided by the staff. The team displayed a remarkable level of professionalism and hospitality that significantly enhanced our dining experience.

The Host: The warm welcome we received from the host set a friendly tone for the evening. Their efficient handling of our reservation and seating was much appreciated.

The Waitstaff: Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely enthusiastic about the menu. They offered personalized recommendations and ensured our orders were perfectly tailored to our preferences.

High Valuable Rating to The Chef: The culinary artistry of the chef was evident in every dish that graced our table. The passion for flavor and quality shone through, making each bite a memorable delight.

High Valuable Rating to The Support Staff: The support staff, often the unsung heroes, were efficient and unobtrusive, keeping the dining area immaculate and running smoothly.

title: Lovely array of food at the restaurant.
text:
This restaurant is in the Doubletree Hilton Hotel, the restaurant is very spacious and provides an array of good quality food, always pizza, pasta, curry, meats, desserts, salads and the breakfast as everything you could possibly want to set you up for the day. 

There is an adult section which is where we sat and always greeted with a smile and walked to the area. Wonderful restaurant!

title: Perfect weekend getaway
text:
Recently, when we couldn't travel abroad for a holiday, we decided to have a weekend getaway in UAE itself. So we booked a weekend stay at Al Hamra Fort Hotel & Beach Resort in Ras Al Khaimah.
It is located beside the Al Hamra Golf Course and the beach is just a couple of minutes away. Its a family friendly resort with spacious rooms and suites. Our room's balcony had the stunning view of the golf course.
The resort is a blend of traditional and modern look. Our room had a Middle Eastern inspired decor. It was fully equipped with modern amenities like flat screen tv, electronic safe, hairdryer, iron board, phone etc. Upon request, we also got a baby cot.
We never got bored for a single moment as the beach was just 2 minutes away. They've a good swimming pool, gym, massage center, kids play area and tennis court.
Apart from the 24 hours in-room dining service, they also have an all-day-dining restaurant, pool bar & terrace and a pub. 
We had a relaxed stay and enjoyed the warm hospitality and impeccable service. Compared to the new and contemporary resorts in RAK, Al Hamra Fort Hotel & Beach Resort looks a bit dated. That's the only flaw.

title: an oldy but a goodie
text: this hotel has been going for many years now and was one of the first places i stayed in when i went to RAK over 10 years ago.  i loved it then and i still love it.  its a resort really, with a great beach, a various of pools, golf, selection of bars, a nightclub and various restaurants to choose from.  at only 45 mins from Dubai airport its a short trip north from dubai.  the rooms are lovely and clean, the staff friendly and its cheaper than Dubai.

text: The lemon-grilled sea bream is a top notch. Highly recommended dish with the lemon rice as a side. Worth every penny. Enjoyed every bit of it.

title: What a find!
text: A spur of a moment decision to eat here (rather than the picnic we had packed) was the right decision. The decor is stunning and the food is beautifully presented. It tastes just as good. We had a great lunch and stayed sitting for over a couple of hours. The portions are plentiful. Staff are very nice. We would definitely go back if we are over in Fujairah again

text: This place one of the best places i have been to . So peaceful and what a great view .its a must try i will definitely recommend .keep up the good work team .

title: Aesthetic designs and cool interior!
text: We ordered lamb chops and it was cooked to perfection! Ambiance was really great! Worth to spend money. Only concern was the arrangement of the tables were too close to each other. The staffs were so attentive.

title: Steki rocks!
text: We had an excellent dining experience at Steki with some amazing food and impeccable service, especially from Gerson. The team was able to cater to our gluten free and vegetarian requirements and made our evening special by customizing the dessert for a birthday celebration. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Fujairah.

title: Amazing experience
text: amazing quantity of food so delicious, the view is amazing by the beach a very nice place to have a drink during the day and specially having the best view over the beach, The waitress she was very kind and welcoming, i will highly recommend  this restaurant to my friends and i will surely comeback in the near future.

title: Average
text: Well I had very average experience!!! Being vegetarian I had very few options and the penne pasta was not tasty at all and the veg soup was so salty and it took 45 mins to serve food. There was only one waitress!! Not a very good experience!!!

title: Average
text:
The Peruvian chef no longer works there and some of the classical Peruvian dishes from their menu were not being offered. This was a total surprise as we only found out at the time of ordering! So, if you find yourself craving some good Peruvian food, this is not the place to go. Service was very slow even though we were the only customers there. However, the waitress was very friendly.

Overall, the food was just average. Nice view over a marina, though.

title: amazing seafood platter
text: We were a bit put off when told that the first two choices we made from the menu were not available, and in the end asked the waiter what actually was available. We then settled on a seafood platter and bratwurst with sauerkraut. (The only bratwurst available was chicken - not sure if there is actually such a thing in Germany!).  So, after that and also because there was only a table of two who were drinking and shisha smoking, not eating, we didn't expect much. However, the seafood was quite amazingly good. A wide variety, cooked to a T and crispy batter on the calamari and fish. Also, not having ever tasted ceviche (Peruvian marinated raw fish) and not knowing what it was, we were all completely hooked. At 110 dhs and enough for two people, we thought it good value.  So full marks on that, not so much on the German dish and service and atmoshphere mediocre, but we would definitely go again for the seafood.

title: No longer in existence
text: This information is really out of date. The German/Peruvian restaurant RJJ in Fujairah has been closed for several years.

text:

Honestly the steaks, yes they were simple cuts, but they could have had the sinew cut off a bit. The rest was very nice especially the calamari.
A nice birthday eat out, kept that one a secret so did not expect any surprises. 
When in the area again will be back.

title: Family Friendly: Great Variety & Value
text: This is a wonderful family oriented restaurant presenting a vast menu at value prices. We had a chicken kebab and a fish kebab from a local type of codfish. The meal came automatically with soup and bread as well as some crudities. The service was very fast and friendly. The evening was a easy to like experience.

title: Good food and prices, need some improvement in service
text:
This restaurant is a decent family place to eat. We had lunch with our family and enjoyed their tasty kebabs and overall good service. Menu is comprised mostly of Persian cuisine, but they have also european food in their menu. 
It is also one of the most popular places for tourists and locals. One can choose to eat in a common hall or have a separate place with curtains to close. Overall it is a calm and welcoming place. 
Food was prepared and brought quite fast and all our ordered meals were huge. So it was quite enough to order three meals for five people and share them among us. It was also quite pleasant to have complimentary soups and vegetable salads with ordered meals from the restaurant - a practice which I have also encountered in some other restaurants in UAE. What I did not like in Sadaf is their lack of friendliness with even simple technologies. They provide clients printed menus with few pictures of meals and simultaneously bring ipads to show pictures of other meals, desserts, etc. However, they have no even prices attached to the pictures, so you have to look them again in printed menu for the prices, or ask waiter when you suddenly find out that those aren‚Äôt in menu at all‚Ä¶ Our main waiter seemed little enthusiastic in advising us not only about meals, but also about complimentary soups and salads, so we ordered and then cancelled same salads‚Ä¶ same waiter in turn was quite fast to check the tips we had left when leaving‚Ä¶
Luckily, we were not served by that single waiter only, and we had much better communication with other waiters serving us‚Ä¶ So I believe, a little more training will be better for some personnel and updating ipad photos with prices and descriptions would be of much better convenience for foreign clients.
By the way, the first floor of Sadaf has a small store that offers Persian sweets, dates, nuts and other tasty food to take with you. 
Overall it‚Äôs a good place to visit, especially given the quality food and good prices (spent around 160 dirhams for our family lunch).

title: Lovely place to stop for a meal
text: Lovely place. Great service.  Tasty food, helpful staff that anticipate your needs. I really enjoyed it here and would come again.

title: Excellent experience

text: Excellent restaurant at the hotel! The food is very tasty and its variety will suit everyone, from the youngest children to adult gourmets. Special thanks to Vismaya, we felt the fullness of hospitality thanks to her extra attention to us and our child! The restaurant, as well as the hotel at the highest level of service, highly recommended! Thank you again Vismaya! You are the best! We will come back here just because of you!

text: We loved our stay. Proerty is nice and calm. Food is very good especially breakfast. Has lots of variety . Loved the service provided by Vismaya in restaurant

title: Excellent service and delicious cuisine
text:
We stayed at the hotel and visited the restaurant every day for seven days. And every day for lunch and dinner new dishes corresponding to different cultures were offered. The restaurant itself is small, the choice is not very large either, but all the dishes were tasty and interesting. Desserts also changed every lunch and dinner without repeating themselves.
The staff is very polite and helpful. I would especially like to mention Vismaya, which brightened up our meal with her positive.

title: Great food, friendly staff
text: We spent our holidays in Address Beach Resort Fujairah and had our breakfasts and dinners at the Restaurant. I'm actually not a big fan of buffet food, but the food was always delicious and full of variety. Every evening a great choice with a special theme.  We have been there with our 1-year old toddler and the staff was super friendly and attentive - a big help when travelling with a toddler. Many thanks to Rahim, Noor, Naga, Abdul, Manesha and team for the great experience at the Restaurant.

title: Great food
text: We ate under a cabana on the beach every evening, the food was excellent and the staff were all very polite and helpful

text:
Me and my family spent very nice time in Waves restaurant and we had perfect dinner with perfect service provided by Kamal. Food was very good, everything nicely prepared and service is perfect, serving food, drinks and we felt very good.
We will definitely come again and hopefully see there soon.

title: Anniversary dinner

text: I really enjoyed dinner at waves restaurant with my friends.Food are very delicious.Staffs services are very satisfying.Special Thanks Hostess Wah Wah for her service.She is very polite and kindly for me & my friends.

Especially service with Gaganpreet, she cared about us very well and other staff service was very good. We are looking forward to come again and go for dinner to Waves again.

title: Very tasty üî•üî•üî• 10/10
text: Today I visited this wonderful place and tasted real delicious seafood. of course, I will recommend grilled shrimp or seafood soup to everyone. insanely delicious! I would also like to mention the employees and waiters who did everything very quickly and deliciously! thank you very much, Yukesh, Gyuna, Sunny and Krishna, they prompted and helped to make a choice, + they took everything out quickly and hot.

title: Birthday dinner in a romantic atmosphere
text: Being on a vacation with family we decided to celebrate my birthday in a sea restaurant. The dishes were fantastic (thanks to Chef Subeesh and team), we tried prawns, steak, salmon and other things. It is difficult to describe everything, you have to try it yourself. The service was great( big thanks to Gyung and team). The part of the atmosphere - the musician who played some interesting instrument. Definitely suggest!

title: Great food, great view, great service
text:
I came here for lunch with a friend and we were both greeted by a very welcoming waitress named Claudia. She offered us a table with a nice view and came frequently to check if we still had enough to drink. 
We were served delicious, though pricey food both from the local as well as foreign quisine, prepared by Aadesh and Pankaj.
I think Claudia tries a little too hard, but all in all I would definitely come again

title: "Amazing Atmosphere and Delicious Food & Service.
text:
We had a wonderful dining experience at Drift Restaurant in the Intercontinental Hotel Fujeirah.

The food was great ‚Äì we enjoyed a delicious selection of dishes, including a refreshing beer, pizza with buffalo mozzarella, beef ragu pasta, and the most delightful tiramisu for dessert.The highlight of our visit was definitely the atmosphere ‚Äì it was perfect for a relaxing evening. 
Service staff was exceptional- Claudia, Chef Pankaj Powar, and restaurant Manager Fathi adding to the overall experience.

 Highly recommended!

title: Great food and vibe
text: Lovely spot for lunch or dinner with great vegetarian options. We had 3 lunches and 2 dinners over the course of a week. They have live music on Friday and Saturday nights which is a nice touch. Special thanks to Gyung who was our lovely waitress!

title: Everything was good and tasty
text: The atmosphere of the place is cozy and stylish, which sets a great mood. The service was top-notch‚Äîpolite and attentive waitstaff. The menu was especially impressive, with a variety of dishes, each deserving praise. I highly recommend ‚Äîit was prepared to perfection. The only downside was the slightly high prices, but overall, the quality of the food and service justifies the cost. I will definitely return here again!"

title: Intercontinental hotel Fujairah Staycation
text:
The hotel is located on the beach with several swimming pools. The rooms are very spacious, we enjoyed the lounge that has a private swimming pool, afternoon tea (3-5pm) and cocktails and snacks (6-8pm). 

Lovely service by Katy at breakfast and all staff in the hotel. They also accommodated us with early check in and late check out, thank you!

title: A must visit resort in Fujairah
text: Even it was a quick stay, I‚Äôve enjoyed the place, food, hospitality and the staff. Katpaeki delivered great service and ensures we‚Äôll have a memorable and pleasant dining and stay. We loved everything Intercontinental Fujairah has to offer! Highly recommended and a must visit!

title: Buffet Lunch Drop in Quality
text: Bit of a drop in standards since we last came here. We had hoped to see the usual wide selection of salads but disappointingly only basic salads with a lot of cheap ingredients, primarily cucumber.  Other food also drop in quality. Rest of hotel still looks great!

title: Poor experience at lunch
text: I drove from Dubai with my mother very hopeful of enjoying a wonderful meal. It came as a shock when we inquired about vegetarian options and were told that they don‚Äôt have vegetarian options except salads. While we proposed possible solutions we were only given the same explanations- sorry we have strict instructions from the management not to deviate from the menu, there are no vegetables etc etc. Eventually we spoke to the chef and gave him a suggestion which was finally acceptable. Unfortunately the risotto was nothing like a risotto and was the first we ever tasted, dry , stale and smothered in sauce!

title: (Wave dibba al husn) Terrible memory
text:
I went to wave dibba with family, on 30 june

 i have faced a terrible experience, they have delayed our simple order for a very very long time!

I have observed that the other tables  who came after us served before us ,

the matcha was  not smoth sweet it was over sweet not  they ran out of ice as well,the waiters didnt seem to care,it was unorganised,serving on their preferred tables!

text: I and my husband visited this restaurant maybe 5 years ago for the first time and we were very happy with the food and the service. After 5 years we were there again and it was really good!!! Service is fast and staff are so friendly. Especially Florence the waitress is the best one i have to say! Thanks to the restaurant to provide this nice food experience for us.

text: You couldn‚Äôt get a restaurant with a better view! The tables are all set looking over the Indian Ocean with Dibba Rock out in the horizon - the ambience is so lovely with salsa music gently playing in the background with the ocean waves crashing in every now and again. The food was really delicious and service from Youssef was excellent- friendly and efficient. Very much a 5 star experience at very good value for money!
