title: Excellent sociable concept
text: What a great way to socialise with people of the same household. The Happy Farm restaurant is a Korean based menu where your table has a pot of soup imbedded in it and you can flavour it with either seafood or meats. Also on the table is a BBQ plate for grilling your food. For a price of 69aed you can eat and drink as much as you like. Warning you will be charged for any left food on your plate. Good policy. Just take what you need. The food and soft drink are delicious and plentiful as is the service. What a great find. Thanks

title: DISGUSTED
text: Firstly cockroaches on the floor caught my eyes and right away I got disappointed üòû that's not the end then I saw small flies. I am definely not going here again. Its not clean and saw staff peoples sneezing in a kitchen ü§ß so for me it's a big NO.

title: new experience
text: Nice Asian experience and helpful team. need to add more items or new ideas and dessert. thank you .

title: Awesome
text: Very very beautiful and relaxing place. Nice staff and good service. The food and drink is also very good. We often visit here and always enjoy the vibe and food.

title: Superb food and service
text:
My husband and I dined here twice during our stay at the hotel.

This restaurant is not part of the all inclusive package. However we decided to dine here on the Surf & Turf night, 
We were given a menu, that we thought you had to choose your starter, main and dessert, however that was not the case.

You are shown the menu, and you get all the food on that menu! 

The portion sizes were huge, so you do need a break between each course.
The starters were mixed ;
selection of cheeses, with a jam/preserve in a cute basket
smoked hazelnuts & black grapes
farro bowl, selection of meats, 
crispy onion rings
burrata, pulled beef
green tomatoes muruglia olive oil
spinach , dried cranberries, pistou, roasted vegetables
turkey ham, chicken pinxto

Mains ;
Angus Beef ribeye
angus striploin
beef back ribs
corn fed chicken
braised lamb leg
sea bream
red snapper
prawns
salmon
with mixed veg, mashed potatoes lemon butter sauce
mushroom sauce

And if you have room for pudding after all that..( we didnt...)
Molten Chocolate cake
mango cheesecake
banoffie pie
fruit platter

All of this including wine, beer was 260 AED ( ¬£53 per person)

Absolutely beautiful food, and great service. 
The Manageress Archie, was so caring and thoughtful, such a beautiful lady with a very kind heart, congratulations on your promotion, so well deserved.

Yes We would highly recommend this beautiful place to dine.

Thank you Archie and your team, ( Uttam if you see this you are a star, you work so hard, good luck on your future ventures xx)

title: The staff give BaB its name!!
text:
As always, a restaurant is known by its staff and Bab Al Bahr is no different. Some of the best service with a smile and great people at the restaurant.

The food is fab, Wasabi prawns, nachos, the sandwiches that we had were very tasty.

The spritz was nicely prepared and tasted fantastic!!

100/100 for the restaurant and the staff!!

Shout out to Pankaj, Aju, Win and Karim who served us and the entire cook and bar staff!!

title: My favourite place
text: My favourite place since I moved to Sharjah. Beautiful and relaxing atmosphere. Excellent service from all the staff. Special thanks to Karim and Anju. They always give their  best to customers with a genuine smile and personalised service!

title: Great food and care
text:
I really enjoy dining, chilling, relaxing here after a long day.

The food is amazing, the vibe is relaxed and the staff is working hard realizing this.

Props to Malin (waiter), the chef and crew taking good care for us.

title: spicy
text: a great Indian taste food, little spicy but we liked it especially the biryani, we had our lunch or dinner many times once in the restaurant near Istanbul supermarket, many times we take it home because always crowded and full tables.suitable price.

title: Authentic Pakistani Taste
text: We ordered the Aloo Paratha and Chicken-Tikka and loved the taste. The portion size is quite big as we cant finish all in one time.

title: very Basic food at high end prices
text:
Does everything a restaurant should do adequately but at a very very basic and unprofessional level
No greeting or recognition on arrival by the management
Everyone looking around uninterested
It‚Äôs ok if you just wanna quick eat.dont expect a nice experience
Food served Luke warm from Karahii to roti to saag.requested spicy food ...got ignored
Not good value for money

title: Very tasty food
text:
the place has one of the best food i've ever tasted in UAE, and the portion is very big, enough for 2 people actually, the bread is sooooo nice 
price wise is very well considered, i would actually rate it cheap compared to restaurants of the same size, well done on that part
the family section on the second floor needs some attention, in Summer its a bit hot.
the place is fairly clean but there is a lot to improve, tables are sticky, and you need to ask the waiter to come clean it (multiple times sometime), the waiters attitude also is not that great, i mean the service is pretty fast, but lets say you ask for additional spoon, for some reason they stare at you like you have asked the forbidden (culture differences?).
the lighting also needs improvements, its a bit (i wouldn't say dark) but it can be brighter, it wont harm.
overall i would give it 3.5 stars

title: Terrible quality of food
text: Had ordered Nihari and tandoori roti for lunch and this is the type of tandoori roti delivered..full of black coal..the biryani was mixed with two types of rice..looks like old food mixed with layer of fresh rice on top..waste of money ordering from here..please be very careful..they serve unhygienic and expired food

title: Danial Restaurant
text:
Danial Restaurant Ajman 

@danialrestaurant.uae has been serving Iranian buffets since 1999 and they have three branches in Ajman, Sharjah & Dubai. I have been to the Ajman branch which is quite huge and I would say it's a perfect place to organize any family or official event there. 
 
They serve Vegetarian, Meat, and Seafood dishes with the addition of Iranian, Asian, Italian varieties as their buffet is priced at AED 50 in Ajman & Sharjah but for Dubai, it's AED 70 which is reasonable as per their wide variety of dishes. Please be informed that this buffet price doesn‚Äôt include Soft Drinks/Fresh Juices or Ice Cream.
 
I have been to this place in Ramadan but this time we went for dinner and it was a great experience as their attentive customer service is outstanding.
 
I would love to say that do visit this place and enjoy the buffet with your family and friends as it's worth visiting besides that they have maintained their quality over the years.

For those who love food and buffets, Daniel Restaurant offers you an abundance of international and Iranian dishes, but it specializes in Iranian food, and in its desserts, the food is delicious and fresh, and the behavior of the staff is sweet, beautiful, and sophisticated. However, I hope they will introduce us to discount services such as Esaad Fazaa or Hamat al-Watan, and for all those who want to order in homes, chalets, or tents, they will offer this to you. The service is even with chairs and tables, but the price depends on the people and what the food is, unless you order it, I advise you to try it and enjoy what is delicious.

title: Love love love
text: As said above loved this place. Fantastic ambiance and great food and drink. Best burger ive ever had and we eat out alot in the UK.

title: Awesome view, terrible staff
text:
We went there to celebrate a friend's Bday. We were a group of nearly 16 people.
The place and view was awesome but just the staff, specially their manager had a terrible attitude.

Will neither ever go again nor will recommend this place

title: Very bad and very rude service and expensive for nothing - AVOID
text:
A terrible place with rude staff and bad service. After waiting for either the waiter or waitress to acknowledge us, with both of them looking at us several times then walking straight past us, the waitress finally deigned to come over and was very rude, very unfriendly and very unwelcoming.i hasten to add that the bar was practically empty but we still waited 15-20 minutes to be served. Unfortunately,noone ever came to serve us so we eventually left and went to the Bab Al Bahr at the Ajman Saray Hotel instead which was excellent.
Also, the drinks at Zanzi Bar are overpriced for nothing especially given the rude staff.
Save your money and avoid this rubbish place

Also we thank valet aprking silverio who escorted us in the zanzi bar and recommended us to have our lunch here.

title: Worst pub ever!
text:
Our visit, hoping for a pleasant family meal like we experienced at other branches in the UAE, turned out to be the worst. We were visiting as a family of 8 including children. I wouldn't recommend this place to any family. The decor and seating were outdated, and the smell of stale smoke greeted us upon entering. There was an intoxicated customer at the bar table who loudly swearing and staggering around. I might expect expect to see this in a local bar but not in an establishment advertising for families.

Upon requesting the waiters moved us to a table closer to the restroom, which was unpleasantly stinky. All of this made us decide to leave even before settling down properly. The manager, Mr. Gunter, showed little interest in understanding our situation and discomfort as a family. Instead, he seemed to make us feel guilty for coming to the pub rather than addressing our concerns and making us feel comfortable. It's clear they may have regular patrons, but we won't be returning ever.

title: Amazing Dinner trip
text: We have been casually walking on Ajman Cornish and saw this beautiful ship, all decorated with lights, we just ask about it, price and their program. Surprisingly price was very attractive, with 2 hours trip, seafood buffet and entertainment program. We decided to go for it. It was such an amazing experience. Staff was very accommodating and supportive, wearing beautiful white marine uniform which was looks really nice. Food was very tasty, fresh, huge variety and delicious. Plus a Tanoora dance guy, performed perfectly. It was really well spent time with this team. Thank you all! We definitely bring family and friends again.

title: Private Party
text: I had booked the full boat for my son's engagement party the weekend before Ramadan 2021, and I am very pleased with the service and quality of food provided to us.  all my guests were extremely happy and I would recommend it to all my friends and family.

title: Floating restaurant | Kids amusement park
text: I couldn't try the floating restaurant because a marriage reception was taking place It was crowded with people with no mask. There is a running track which leads to a kids amusement park. A small settup.Not sure if this will be temporary or permanent. Kids rides are paid and some even offers unlimited time. Few stalls with dress accessories toys perfumes are there at the moment. Food stalls are a total rip off. Temperatures are checked at the beginning.  The place could be a JBR if developed with proper standards. Many shops are yet to open. No toilets are available at the moment. Pets are not allowed however there were many and security didnt seem to bother. Almost no other option available for dinner other than the floating restaurant

just more attention with cooking time of some items not to overcook.

title: Excellent food, impeccable service
text:

Definitely recommend any of the juices, Moroccan mint tea, lamb stew‚Ä¶basically anything you order is great, and the people are kind, helpful and professional.

title: Ramen
text: I recently dined at Oumi Ramen in Sharhaj and I was thoroughly impressed by their ramen. The flavors were outstanding, with a rich, savory broth and perfectly cooked noodles that really showcased the authenticity of the dish. The ingredients tasted fresh and high-quality, which is crucial for a genuine ramen experience. The attention to detail in the preparation and presentation truly sets this place apart. If you‚Äôre looking for an authentic taste of Japan, this restaurant is a must-visit.

title: Nice italian restaurant
text: I loved the pink pasta, pesto mozzarella salad. Quick delivering and food is served hot. One of the best italian restaurants üëçüèº

title: the best pizzas in town
text:
It was dinner out during our visit the last weekend....and I must say that Italiere turned out to surprise us. 

Ambience - very modern
Staff - extremely courteous.
Food - U have to really really try this place out
Bill - Not so bad.....for a dinner out. 

Ordered for the Pepperoni Pizza, Chocolate Cake with a mix of Gelato Ice cream and angus steak. 

The pizza was one of the best that we have had in a long time. The steak was well done to our requirement. The quantity served was right enough for each person.

The dessert was really satisfying. 

The attitiude of the staff from the chef at the counter to the staff serving to the person greeting you and wishing you a good bye says that they are a truly motivated team ensuring complete customer happiness at all times.

Guys....this place is a must try.

title: Good pizza & pasta
text: This is a reliable choice for good pizza (with a nice crust) and pasta. The salads are nice as well, especially the one with strawberries. The gelato is pretty special with some interesting flavors.

title: Great pizza
text:
Been here more than 5 times
Very fresh and tasteful ingredients, friendly staff
I would recommend trying pizza or pasta (and of course both because why not)

They offer Hasbean coffee beans served by a talented barista 

I also order online from time to time (very fast delivery and hot food)

title: Good food, very expensive
text:
It looks like the management of this restaurant overestimates it a bit. Italiere is located next to a suburban area of Muwaileh in Sharjah, and the only advantage for us was that it only took a few minutes to reach the place after we picked up our hungry kid from school. 
The d√©cor is nice and modern, but nothing extraordinary. 
The food was generally alright. 
What we got: a tiny portion of mushroom soup (very tasty though), large Margharita pizza, Calamari Spiedini as an appetizer, mixed salad with baby mozzarella, some milkshake and fresh orange juice. 
What we paid: AED 182.70 (USD 50). This is the price we normally pay for lunch in 4- and 5-star hotels. Very expensive for such an ordinary set up.

title: Volcano Cake
text: Minimalist, trendy, hipster decor.  Good coffee and awesome cakes.  Healthy meal options - I had roasted butternut pumpkin dish, while my friend enjoyed the salmon.  The highlight was the chocolate molten volcano cake served with raspberries and vanilla ice cream.  This was chocolate heaven, sooooo good!

Would love to come here again next time on Thursday!

One of the oldest restaurant in UAE. Taza is serving healthy, fresh & well-balanced. There food/menu can carter the Arab, indian, pakistani, Filipino & the west. They are serving delicious food like BBQ, Kebab, tikka, rice, broast & burgers. These products are prepared and cooked in a traditional way with a quick service.

Their meals are pocket friendly & delicious. Highly recommended place & food.

title: Healthy Option
text: Your typical subway with prompt staff and fresh greens. Great for budget travellers. The chocolate cookies are good. You can also try the local flavours which may not be available outside UAE. Safe bet.

title: The best fresh food restaurant
text: For me, it is the best at all to provide healthy and light food, I have visited many branches and tried to digest .. The service is excellent and the restaurant is very clean, and the bread is fresh as it bakes every branch, eating very clean and prices are very good .. You also taste Tasty cookies are baked, do not forget to take a card in order to place a stamp every time you buy from the restaurant and when filling the card in full you will be given half a delicious sandwich of your choice.

title: Nice ambience and a quick delicious bite
text: My friend and I just went on a trip from Oman and we landed in Sharjah airport. We look for food court and they only had limited restaurants in there so we decided to just choose subway since it is convenient. We ordered the Italian BMT and and we shared the footlong sandwich with fresh ingredients and it was delicious. The counter guy was also very nice to talk to very helpful. He tried to upsell his products so we decided to buy more add ins like cookies and chips. All in all it‚Äôs a good place to eat and have a quick delicious bite.

title: Nice place for a quick bite
text:
I visited the Subway outlet for lunch, when I was running short of time and was looking for a reliable, healthy option. I went for the combo, which was priced well and came with a delicious sandwich (I opted for 6 inch), a pack of chips and a soft drink.

The food was prepared quickly. The sandwich tasted nice and fresh. The chips packet was a nice snack to munch on the way. Seating was an issue; very little seating space and no real ambience; otherwise it was ok.

title: Al Majaz
text: A good place to stop by in Sharjah, best place for a family union or friends gathering or just to have nice time and good food while overlooking the gulf waters. The coloured water fountain and nice atmosphere enhances the pleasure of night.

title: dine inn
text:
i like to dine inn alone, its so relaxing especialy the venue very quiet and clean. The staff very approchable.
The management should complement the staff and reward them even in a simple award.
keep up the good work buheirah branch!

title: Chin chin
text: We got the delivery from @chinchinuae from Muweilah branch, Sharjah.. they have 10 branches in Dubai and 2 branches in Sharjah.. typical chinese taste.. we ordered the following food: hot pot:noodles cooked with chicken in schezwan bean sauce.. Quantity wise good,hot and sauce was nice with small corns and broccoli.. next was the crispy beef and i heard they are one of the best dishes there and as said they were too good‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è..crispy texture and thin beef strips.. next is mongolian beef with semi gravy texture which is was above average for me.. chicken schezwan fried rice was good and flavour wise amazingüòã..next in veggy choice was the cottage cheese chilli fry.. good,huge pieces of cottage cheese, freshness felt and coated with spices.. and our very personal favorite chicken manchurianüòç.. fried chicken bits in rich manchurian sauce was good.. overall good food..good customer service and good food quantity.. @dubaifoodfest @dsssocial #dubaiblogger #allaboutfood #foodexplorer #foodbloggers #dubaifood #dubai #mydubai #dubaifoodie #life #love #foodhunt #foodporn #food #foodie #foodphotography #dubaifoodies #dubaifoodblogger #dubaifoodbloggers #foodgasm #instafood #dubaifoodguide #bloggerlife #uaeblogger #faseejani #chinchin #chinesefood #beef #chicken #noodles #schezwan

title: A brand that is known to all for its Chinese Cuisine.
text:
We have been eating their food for quite some time. Their combo meals used to be our go to option whilst at work since it was filling and convenient too.

So this time we decided to try out their food from the Sharjah branch, and what better day to pick when its raining and a comfort bowl of hakka noodles with pelts of rain hitting the window sill.

Even with harsh weather conditions, the food was delivered on time. In addition, the delivery personnel maintained sanitary protocols by wearing a mask and gloves which we appreciated.

Rating: 7 Golden Nuggets

Bite Board

Drums of Heaven [AED 28]: The chicken lollipops tasted delicious. Perfect crunchy exterior which we love. We got about 9 pieces in one box which is quite a lot. If you need that extra tang you can dip it into some soy sauce and have it as well.

Crispy Beef [AED 40]: The crispy beef was cooked a little over well done for us. It was too hard and the flavour overall was overwhelmingly sweet which wasn‚Äôt something we expected nor liked. Giving this a pass.

Chicken Fried Rice [AED 26]: This tasted good. The fried rice was flavorsome with a mix of a generous amount of egg and chicken pieces which we appreciated. The quantity was well enough to serve 2 to 3.

Chicken Manchurian [AED 36]: This is our staple order when we get Chinese food and though the consistency was slightly on the watery end than we would have liked, the flavours were all there. Again generous chunks of chicken and paired well with the fried rice.

Chicken Hakka Noodles [AED 32]: The noodles tasted delicious with a considerable portion size as well. Again for that extra tang, we added some soy sauce to it to bring it all together.

Mongolian Beef [AED 40]: This one is known to be on the sweeter side so we were expecting it to be a little sweet and it was. However the beef pieces were cooked well and weren‚Äôt tough and we liked the sauce used here as well.

Overall, they are worth a shot and currently have some good deals going on which will make the food quite reasonable and allow you to support local business as well.

title: Good veg Chinese food
text:
For starters we had Wonton Baskets with vegetables & Potato chilli dry. Though the presentation of the Wontons Basket was amazing , taste wise I would give a 10/10 to Potato Chilli dry. Where the Wonton Baskets had a pretty average taste, Potato Chilli dry was hero of the starters.¬† A very unique taste for Potatoes in Chinese style ( a must try ).

For main course we had Veg Manchurian & Thai Red curry . I was impressed by the size of the Manchurian balls which were quite big compared to the usual ones we see . The taste was pretty average but the portion could easily suffice two person. Thai Red curry was a winner , both in taste & presentation. One of the best Thai Curry I had till date ( a must try ).

Veg fried rice & Schezwan noodles were the ending dishes of our meal. Both were equally tasty & had the authentic taste. Schezwan noodles could be called a complete meal in itself & can be savored solo.

The food was very clean along with value for money portions. Overall would definitely go back to this place for Thai Curry , Schezwan Noodles &¬† Potato Chilli

title: Chin chin
text:
This food from chin chin was delivery from majaz. The delivery retained the food heat. Packed well and in very good portions. 
The following were ordered:
1.Hot pot noodles: cooked with chicken with schezwan sauce- this hot pot noodles is their special noodles and veggies cooked for hours on slow heat. The taste is unique, different and yummy flavour wise. Veggies were cooked well. Sauce coated well and fresh noodles to compensate and in very good quantity.
2.crispy beef- as the name says beef strips are thin, coated well and fried and covered with sauce. The crispiness is top notch. Beef cooked well and bit spicy in nature.
3.mongolian beef-Loved the tangy flavour. Bit spicy and sauce is very different from the usual sauce. A mongolian touch for sure. Beef cooked well and soft as well.
4.chicken schezwan fried rice- the best fried rice in town. With chicken bits, spicy nature of rice, cooked perfectly and in good quantities. Perfect fried rice and its must try.
5. cottage cheese chilli fry- if u love cottage cheese this dish is for you. Red coated sauce on the cottahe cheese makes it more spicy, a bit soft nature on the cheese and a bit of sweet touch.
6. Chicken manchurian- this is the ultimate dish for us in chinese and never miss the dish. Loved the flavours and the chicken cooked well and the gravy perfected coated with the chicken.

Overall good food, good quantity, and good service.

title: Chinese Cusines
text: Best Chinese cusines in town, prawn dynamite and mangolian beef is unbeaten, and hot garlic chicken taste is unmatched, recommended!!!!

title: Excellent family restaurant
text: Very good restaurant by Al Majaz water front. variety of dishes for kids and adults.Good decor and ambience.

title: BTR Chipmunks Chipettes Hunks WWE Leo Laila Hollywood Max Keke Kayslee Isha Likes Celebs Stars Pumpkin January & People.
text: WWE WWF Leo Laila BTR Chipmunks Hunks Chipettes Hunks Friendships Hello Happy Smile Glee Victorious & More.

title: Tasty food, wonderful venue
text:
Dine at the restaurant for the 1st time, checked their nicely presented menu, lovely sitting area with view of the corniche.

Food is sooo tasty, ingredients seems fresh, huge servings.

Had a good chat with a friend while dining at the same time.

Staff are accommodating.

Overall, perfect experience.

Will come back with husband.

title: Nice ambiance but food is not so great.
text: We had a good time because it is overlooking the waterfront. Foodwise nothing extraordinary. I asked for my fav. Turkish coffee and they asked me if I want with sugar. I clearly said no but I ended up with a sweet coffee. My sister asked omelet, but she received a  very dry one. My poached egg is well done as well. The toast though is very good.

title: Work on your cleanliness
text: Food was ok and atmosphere was amazing ! Terrible on hygiene and cleanliness and also the staff attitude on cleanliness and hygiene ! They could brush up on their attitude as well and not taking customers for granted

title: Cheap and good
text: I keep going back every time I can't talk my date into Sandwiches or Fish & Chips.  So I keep going back...  Good, inexpensive chinese.  Very tasty and great service.

title: Average oriental cuisine experience
text: Having tried Chinese wonton noodles and Schezuan chicken rice I can say they are average. Wonton noodles in malaysia is generally served dried but was bit surprised when I received this dish in a soup - more like a cube-soup taste. Schezuan chicken rice could have been spicier. Qty is little compared with its menu price - something for the Admin to consider. Nothing to complain though.

title: Won‚Äôt rush back
text: Basic Chinese fare - ours was not wonderful quality and timing was bad as dishes cold. Cheap to be fair and they take Entertainer, but sometimes you just wish you had paid more for quality

title: Wrong delivery
text: Wrong Delivery and take too much time for the correct one that i order . Another bad experience of wrong delivery of my order.

title: VERY POOR food quality, not worth for the price
text:
Airconditioning is not good.
Chicken barbecue is not fresh, meat is hard.
Spring roll is not crispy.
Dimsum is not well steamed.
Rice is not cooked well.

Didn't expect to pay so much for the food. It's not worth it. Better order grilled chicken somewhere, for sure it's fresh.

I hope Chowking will listen to feedback and improve their food quality.

title: Great menu and food
text: Great place to eat with good menu. Food is good and their is great variety. Has ample space for dine in and they have good breakfast menu

title: If your hungry don‚Äôt visit after 03:00
text: 3rd night visit and 3rd time told NO food available for 15-20 mins ! Apparently every night at 03:00 they ‚Äúclean‚Äù all the grills so cannot accommodate any item on the menu. You‚Äôd of thought for a ‚Äú24hour‚Äù restaurant in the middle of the ‚Äúnightlife district‚Äù they‚Äôd choose another time to do the daily/nightly clean but no, as soon as the bars and clubs close this restaurant decides to do its cleaning. Again losing hundreds of dirham as people walk straight back out and visit neighbouring fast food outlets ! Don‚Äôt bother to ask for the manager or any contact details for franchise owners/head office as they don‚Äôt have a clue ! Just try and fob you off with the survey on the back of receipts !

title: Terrible food
text: I don‚Äôt eat junk food anymore, nevertheless I was craving the last 2 weeks for a whopper and a chicken burger. My assumption was that Burger King is better than Macdonald, well it is much worse. I ate there yesterday it is by far one of the terrible meals I ever had, whopper meat was seriously thin plastic and chicken burger has nothing to do with any chicken taste. When did Burger King go so bad?

title: Typical Fare
text: Prefer BK to Maccas and this meal deal didn't disappoint. Unlike the Airport operation we got a Twin Turbo meal, 2 burgers, fries & a drink for a quick snack to ward off the hungries for 13 AED , a very reasonable outcome when busy sight seeing. Can do a lot worse then this!

title: WOW Burgers
text: ordered the burger combos, the food was piping hot, great ambiance, quick service, easy to get parking

title: Good Chicken Meals
text: it's in downtown, the name now is Taza (Tazej in Arabic), located in Hamdan Center where you can do some shopping while waiting for your order, big area to sit in 2nd floor, they offer free fresh backed bread while you eat. prices are good and meal quality and quantity are good also. they make also rice in different ways to suit all nationalities.

title: Better than expected
text:
I ate in the Al markaziyah branch. The food was very good; the fried chicken was very crispy, the rice was well seasoned, and the fries were tasty too.
However the store interior was very basic, it felt like a small food court with no effort in terms of design or ambience. 
All in all it was a good experience.

title: Review
text: We bought broasted Chicken and seriously its like a rubber band we are eating we bought 12 pieces bucket and we couldn't ate that and ended that broast to put in trash.

title: Grilled and fried Chicken
text:
Not fresh as the name of this fast food restaurante states ‚ÄúTAZA‚Äù. The Bbq chicken wasn‚Äôt good at all, mandi and maharaja not bad the rice however the chicken wasn‚Äôt fresh as well.
Not a good experience

title: Worst experience ever in my life
text: This is worst experience ever in my life i ordered boast regular to make spicy but the staff were also rude not giving attention to the costumer and main thing is it was not cooked well inside it was a lots of blood coming from the chicken pieces  and the fries given were so cold even they don't know how to talk to the costumer as well i will not recommend anyone to go this worst place ..... üëã

title: Outstanding‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:
I had really great time here at mukbang shows restaurant 
The food is great very hygienic and the staff are so accommodating that you will feel so special and loved
Thankyou

title: Lovely
text:
Thanks for the great food and the service
It reminded of the Korea 
Really beautiful and authentic Korean food
Had a great time

title: Respect
text:
This spot is outstanding 
i and my friends dined here and all of us were satisfied with the food and service
i cant believe a restaurant can be this nice and caring
will def come here again.

title: Samgyup Night
text: They have good food. Great service from the staffs. Thank you to the staff of Mukbang Shows Restaurant especially to Jem and Vanessa. Very accommodating and friendly.

title: A taste of Korea in AbuDhabi
text: Thank you ate vanessa, ate jem and all the crew. Had a wonderful time here. Food the service staff are great. Will dine here again. Maybe tom?? Hihi

title: Meat lovers pizza is the best
text:
Average = Good

Although we know that the prices are above average but we gave it a try.

we ordered one chicken and one meat lover, the meat lover was way way better. The chicken was not fresh.

I picked and ate at home.

title: Meh
text: Ordered a plain 4 cheese pizza, it was so chewy I ended up throwing it away. The delivery time however was quite fast and as far as price it wasn‚Äôt very expensive, I guess you get what you pay for.

title: Very good
text: Contrary to theflackster's review, I think 800 pizza is one of the best italian restaurants in Abu Dhabi, with truly authentic Italian taste. Very importantly it's one of the only Italian restaurants with a proper wood fire oven for there pizza's (hence the authenticity). I have never been disappointed by the excellent quality of there products. I almost never go to there restaurant, I normally order online. No complaint so far.

title: Avoid
text:
Colleagues at work decided you eat from here.

The dough was crispy and thin and hard.
The cheese was dehydrated and tasteless.

The meat based pizza was extra oily.

title: Authentic Italian Pizzas
text: The best pizzas in Abu Dhabi. Fast delivery and excellent taste. Great value for money for delicious pizzas.

title: Restaurant in Shams Boutique, Al Reem Island
text: While walking around Shams Boutique, I decided to stop by this cafe for lunch and was left a little upset. Firstly, the prices for such food are simply high. For such a small sandwich it cost about 60 dirhams, which I think is a lot since the sandwich is super small. At Subway, a large sandwich costs about 45 dirhams. Also the presentation looks very bad, because when waiter put a plate to my tables some of potato wedges almost fallen down from the plate. We can say that the Subway cannot compare with this restaurant in terms of service, but I never received serviced service at Nando‚Äôs. The waiters had upset faces and at the end they asked me if I could leave a tip. Dear restaurant, this question from the waiters puts the guest in a very awkward position, because it is almost like begging. If the guest liked the service and food, he will leave a tip without question. The only thing I liked was that the milkshake which was delicious. I might come here again for the drinks, but not the food.

title: Over officious manager
text:
Disappointingly officious manager refused to serve us coffee's/water because we weren't sitting in the "right place".  We explained that as we had our small but often noisy parrot with us it was better to sit on outer tables and not potentially annoy other guests, as we have done on several occasions previously!  Unfortunately he wasn't having any of it. Apparently if "we sat there others might try to as well" - bizarre! 
Not a big issue but frankly ridiculous, wonder if the owners know he is turning away business - and the parrot is a great attraction usually for the many kids there, she loves the attention. And normally the staff are so good with her and us. 
Disappointing certainly having driven across town specifically to go there but plenty of other places to take our money these days, and closer to home!

title: Amazing time at Tasha‚Äôs
text: We had an amazing time at Tasha‚Äôs tonight. Dineos service was incredible and she has such a lovely smile. There was a slight mix up with one of our orders which Craig and Dineo sorted out straight away. Craig was so friendly and helpful. We cannot wait to go back!

title: Lovely spot and food
text:
This is a great restaurant.

The decor is very cool and the location on the waterfront is great.  There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.

We ordered chicken pasta and a beetroot quinoa salad with a side of fries for our mains. The food was fresh, well sized, served quickly and absolutely delicious.

For dessert we shared a banana bread - served warm with Nutella and ice cream - and a huge portion.

The prices were fair for the quality.

title: Incredible experience
text:
This will forever be one of my favorite spots in Abu Dhabi. The ambiance, the, service, the staff are all impeccable tbh. The staff alone make you want to come back and visit everytime. Tarneem is one of my favorite people ever, her smile alone and how welcoming she is make me feel so happy as soon as I enter. Honestly, Tasha‚Äôs is super lucky to have a staff member as accommodating as she is. Even if I don‚Äôt want to visit Tasha‚Äôs to try something new, knowing tarneem is there makes me want to visit again. 
I‚Äôve tried almost all of the menu and these are my recommendations: the kale salad (no onion), the pesto pasta (one of the best in Abu Dhabi), the chicken vol au vent, the chicken livers (wow btw), the blood orange granita, and omg for dessert the pumpkin fritters. Listen I hate anything with pumpkin but this is another level. Pls try it and thank me later

title: Tashas Bfast second to none
text:
I cannot recommend Tashas Al Bateen enough, the service, views, quality of food were all top notch. I would say this is a reasonably priced venue based on the above. Whether you are visiting Abu Dhabi or resident here, do yourself a favour - you will not be disappointed.

Definitely try the Spanish Eggs or Breakfast Bun, these were my favourite.

title: Great quality, decent portions and offer during Ramadan!
text:
Loved the whole experience! 
I‚Äôve seen some reviews here that portions are not big - I would argue this as compared to any sushi place in London, portions were double the size! Sushi were extremely fresh (we had California and crab special) and miso soup was big enough for two. Moreover, they had a Ramadan offer where for 56 dhs you get a salmon salad, California and a pot of home made lemonade - a real bargain! Gyozas and spring rolls were nice too.
Highly recommend!

title: Salmon Obsession love it

title: Unacceptable 2 hour meal prep with no warning to customers
text: Trash, they have zero respect for customers and delay your order up to 2 hours...unacceptable when dealing with seafood.  Do not order from them or dine with them.

title: Extremely bad and disappointing. Highly unprofessional.
text: I am a Sushi Central customer since 12+ years. I mostly order for delivery. Last few times and specifically last time end of August 2023, I have faced tremendous delays, irresponsible and unprofessional call center from both Sushi Central and deliveroo. I have spent a considerable amount of money for my order, they promised a specific time with a certain +buffer time to deliver. However they did not commit but instead my order was 2+ hours late. despite of of all my calls to Sushi Central directedly and to Deliveroo, and which I learned later that my order was very late produced by Sushi Central kitchen. I complained many times and the maximum was a very small amount of refund offered even thought I informed them it would be my last time to order after 12+ years of being your loyal client. But seems they didn't and dont 'care. I am very disappointed how you don't look at retaining your bread and butter clients...

title: Very poor customer service
text: Very poor customer service. I ordered sushi from them, the delivery was late by 55 minutes. When I called operator, the person said that she would find out where the delivery guy and would call me back - she didn‚Äôt call me back. Also one item was missed from my order. Unacceptable service and poor customer focus.

title: Pub attached to Sheraton hotel
text: Pub attached to Sheraton hotel is typically English . Made to look old and could be busy but was. Dead Wehrmacht we visited . Happy hour prices excellent as on selected beers is nearly all day . Gave big screens here showing obscure football . Don‚Äôt show any premier league . Such a pity even if it was recorded due to time difference . Good menu for  food and drinks . Beer in happy hour was 15 dhs .

title: A Million Dollar View
text:
Dine at the 3rd Avenue in Dubai Mall overlooking the spectacular light show.. What a beautiful location, a million dollar view and a lot of potential for development.

 The menu looks fantastic and the premises and location looks great too‚Ä¶ However this place has not moved on, from its glory days, when it was new and fresh..there are slight maintenance issues, wear and tear and cleanliness needed.

There should never be any broken or chip furniture insight of customers, especially if it could cause safety issues. There are 
areas that need to be addressed, such as the balcony.. so much more could be done.. rather, it is lifeless. The exterior balcony design is flat, it‚Äôs cold and not very welcoming‚Ä¶ has no view appeal.. Furniture need variation, a little warmth.. some plants, pottery, matts, lights or candles, soft seating etc..

Management needs to be a bit assertive and run a great team, providing a great team spirit and harmony to showcase your assets‚Ä¶ ‚Äú Service & Food‚Äù

The menu, like I said looked great, but the food I ordered was disappointing, it was bland lifeless once again. Food should always look alive and fresh!‚Äô 
The food menu for some dishes should describe exactly what is being served. I ordered a Shrimp burger slider meal and what I got was a flat patty with chopped up chives or whatever it was.. I was expecting a tasty juicy crunch biting into a shrimp with my patty??? But no.. if only they did!!! It would have made all the difference and I would have been prepared to pay extra dollars for that value and experience‚Ä¶ 

All in all, the location and sight made up for the short comings of the food experience‚Ä¶ but restauranteurs!‚Äô Never rely on location or view or background of your restaurant to bring in the clientele.. Food, Food, and Great Service..

I must make special mention of our waiter John! He was delightful and very professional. His mannerisms and personality was very charming and attentive‚Ä¶ He will be an assert to your restaurant given the time and investment. 

Have great day and all the best.

title: Poor quality of food from Gazebo
text: Ordered Lucknow mutton curry which  had a base of some other curry and the mutton itself didn't have the flavor of the spices or the curry. I guess they just mixed the fresh mutton with that base and completed the curry, not at all valued for paying Aed 50 for it. The butter nan was not crispy and it was like tearing an elastic. Also ordered hyderabadi veg curry which was also not upto the quality standard. Didnt expect this from Gazebo brand. I took it as a take way from Forsan Mall branch tonight.

title: Great subtle Biryani and excellent service!! loved it!
text: We were five on a fairly busy evening! They have some booths with curtains and a call bell to get the attention of a waiter. Mohammed Shoiab, our waiter was all smiles and great service throughout!  They seated us in a cozy booth for six. We started out with a Pista and Mango Lassi. The free papad chat they brought us was good. The Pista one was light and airy. The appetizers Tandoori Broccoli and Paneer were very good. The entrees we ordered were a Bhindi dish and a panneer dish.  The Naan was tandoori, no oil, Fluffy and outstanding.  The Veggie Biryani and the Panneer biryani came in their mud pots, exotic and full of flavor! All in all excellent food and great friendly service. Worth a visit and a second and a third.....

title: A Wonderful Experience
text:
Lunch with family
We reached around 1.45PM - we did not have any reservations, but we were seated promptly.

Our order was Murgh RelAla kebab, galawti kabab, bharwan paneer tikka, Buuna Murgh, murgh Malai kabab bIryani, - with lasooni naan, masala papad, rocket anar rait and lassi

The rezala kabab was our server's recommendation. While a bit spicy, it was an excellent dish 10/10.

The gawlati kakab, as my favourite, was perfectly made 10/10

The paneer tikka, a tad bit dry, but still very well made - 8/10

The bhuna murgh, also another server's recommendation, was the star of the lunch. Perfectly spiced, not too much, and soft tender chicken with the garlic naan really hit the spot - 10/10

Lastly, the malai tikka biryani, will always be a personal favourite, although the others at the table could've wanted a spicer biryani. Maybe next time, but for now 10/10

We also added in a masala papad and Amar raita, both of which were great accompaniments.

We decided to forego dessert this time. 

Also, here I would like to mention our server LAXMAN, who kept good pace with the serving, getting our orders customized, and was attentive to our table all evening in spite of the busy lunchcrowd.

I also realized later that I could have availed of a Fazza discount, but was not asked. It's not an issue, but would have availed of a 30% discount. 

All in all a great experience yet again.

My Scorecard:

Food Quality: 10/10
Food Variety: 10/10
Service: 10/10
Atmosphere: 9/10
Value for money: 10/10

Would go back 10/10

title: Overpriced Cheese & Wine "Experience"
text:
I would generally agree with the 5 star rating that other reviewers have given JTG,  based on my first evening's dinner I had there.  Great service (with a smile), food arrived promptly and was very tasty and plentiful, and priced reasonably.  For the following evening's special, I took advantage of the 'unlimited wine and cheeseboard' offer.  What a disappointment... a huge disappointment.  
The selection of cheeses I got on the cheeseboard was pathetic, especially considering that JTG has an impressive array for sale.  As I recall, a slice of cheddar, a slice of brie, some smokey cheddar, cut into small cubes, and a Wensleydale Cranberry Cheese, essentially on the cheaper end of the cheeses they'd normally sell individually.  This was garnished with a few grapes, dried apricots and walnuts.  The waiters were surly, entirely uninterested and I felt as though I was imposing.  My first glass of wine took a good 10 minutes to arrive, and the cheeseboard (bear in mind that the only preparation is to cut some cheese and add a few crackers) took another 10 minutes to arrive, there were three waiters working a total of 6 tables, essentially 14 guests, so they weren't rushed.   The Shiraz I had was mediocre but palatable, so that sufficed, but again, the second glass took so long in coming I'd practically given up.  Unfortunately the experience left a bad taste in my mouth (pun intended) and the disappointment was made worse by the expectations of service the previous night had promised.  Totally not worth the price for this "experience".  Save up, buy the cheeses you'd like to try and make your own cheeseboard or charcuterie at home with a good bottle of wine, it'll be better value for money, and the service will be far more cosy!

title: Chicken biryani 65
text: Mahfil Hyderabad Restaurant. After reading the reviews about the chicken biryani 65 I knew I had to try this place. If you like spicy biryani this is definitely the place. Biryani is served with yogurt sauce. I also ordered the mix vegetable curry and Moghali Chicken curry. Seating area inside only. Family hall available. Parking is in front of the restaurant. You can also find parking within walking distance. Good customer service.

title: Yummy
text:
As you get on the escalator headed to the third floor in Khalidya Mall, your senses take over as the comfortable and delicious smell of cinnamon stimulates your nose. From that moment on, you are on autopilot headed straight for the source of this aroma. Cinnabon. 
Once you get there, the battle begins between common sense and your urgency to buy and eat as much as you can from this delicious food. Your common sense always comes out a loser here, as you enjoy the delights of the cinnamon buns they serve.

title: Great potential but needs some work
text:
This restaurant I had a bit of an identity crisis. The menu is a complete mix of food styles from Mexican to Japanese to sea food etc. so the name appears to only be connected to the fish tank inside the restaurant. The atmosphere was confusing too, the place looks like a smarter style restaurant as opposed to the sports bar across the path, yet the music was too loud and too base heavy for anyone hoping to have a normal conversation with their fellow diners. 

Our experience was mixed too, General quality was good, fish and sushi were fresh and tasty, ceviche was odd, mash potato was awful. 

Finally our experience with the service was very disappointing. While all interactions were very friendly and helpful, trying to get service was almost impossible. We had to constantly go looking for a waiter/ress to get service, get cutlery after food was delivered without it, ask for extra drinks, ask for condiments that were not on the table etc. 

So all in the place had decent food and good value but could be sooo much better with some attention to service standards and a clearly defined identity on product and ambiance.

The service is very slow, and the staff walk around as if they don't see you. On Instagram, everything looks beautiful, but in reality, it's not cozy at all. Only apple-flavored shisha is available, and there are no other flavors. The evening was ruined!

title: Very overpriced!
text: Very overpriced, no atmosphere, over tentative safe, food mediocre! We were not given any time to browse the menu and rushed throughout the meal. Would not recommend.

title: Horrible service. And cacio e Pepe done with parmigiano!
text:
I brought my family here (parents, wife and daughter) and I am Italian. I used to bring here my clients.
The service this time was terrible. The waiter kept insisting I am Romanian, although I was explicitly asking to speak with someone who speaks Italian. Cacio e Pepe was done with parmigiano (it is supposed to be done with pecorino Romano, a specific kind of pecorino from Sardinia which has more seasoning and salt added in Rome).
The waiters removed our wine once, and I stopped them as the glasses had wine left. Then I went to play with my little daughter and when I was back my parents were pissed and all our wine glasses disappeared.
I asked to speak with someone who is Italian. It took me a while as they tried to let me speak with everyone else (although they were promising me to speak with someone who speaks Italian multiple times).
Then, the only Italian speaking waiter came to me. He is nice and off course would have never endorsed something like this.
The bottom line: avoid this place if you are Italian or you know what you can expect from an Italian restaurant. In bocca al lupo.

title: Terrible Experience ! Do not order the steak tartare.
text:
Terrible experience ! We went there for our Anniversary and my husband ordered the Steak Tartare amongst other things.

Which Michelin Restaurant put mayonnaise in their steak tartare ! Absolutely terrible and making the meat extremely slimy and tasteless. Being French, trust me I have had this many times and this was the worst steak tartare I have ever tasted in my life.

When asked by our waitress my husband informed her that the meal was horrible and pushed it aside after two bites of it. She then proceeded to take away the plate.

However when paying the bill we were charged for the Steak Tartare which is absurd and very arrogant ! This is in bad taste and highly disappointing. Who does that ?!

We will definitely Not be rushing back there.

title: Not like other Cipriani restaurants

title: Afternoon tea at MAJLIS
text:
We recently visited Majlis  lounge for  an afternoon tea with family, hoping for a delightful experience, but unfortunately, we were met with disappointment.

The quality of the food was lacking across the board. the scones were overcooked and crumbly, missing the light, buttery texture we had anticipated.

Service was equally underwhelming. Despite the restaurant not being overly busy, our server was inattentive and seemed disinterested in providing a pleasant experience. We had to ask multiple times for basic items which further detracted from the experience.

Overall,  the afternoon tea did not meet our expectations for a quality afternoon tea. With many better options available, it‚Äôs unlikely we‚Äôll be returning in the future.

text: The restaurant found at in Saadiyat was very cozy.  Staff, particularly Sheldon, were friendly and menu was indeed apt to the place visited. We ordered steak in ciabatta bread with salad, turkey and Swiss cheese sandwich wrap, circle chicken skewers, bagel chips and dips and rainbow cake were all amazing. title: Fabulous food and great breakfast deal!
text: Superb breakfast and gorgeous salads. Love the all you can eat weekend deal, our go to place for breakfast on saadiyat. Home delivery was also great and I would highly recommend the avocado toast with eggs and the goats cheese salad!

title: Bad experience at Circle Cafe Saadiyat
text:
This morning I took my 2 children (5 and 10) for a relaxed weekend breakfast out at Circle Cafe Saadiyat (near Waitrose). A very unfortunate decision.

We arrived shortly after 8 am. We were the only guests. The ratio of visible staff (4) to guests (3) was 1.333 to 1. 

We went for the ‚ÄúAnything you order‚Äù for me and the kids. I ordered one English Breakfast l, a half haloumi bagel and a half tuna bagel. These duly arrived an incredible 30+ minutes later. The half bagels were OK. The English breakfast was iffy. The omelette was woefully overcooked, the bacon was > 50% fat.

At 8:50, I ordered a slice of cake and 2 small pancakes for the kids (desert) and a spicy omelette (Bombay). The cake and pancakes arrived 10 mins later and were good. 45 minutes and 2 reminders later, there was no sign of the Omelette. I asked for the bill, paid the full price and left, nearly 2 hours after we arrived. My final bill of AED 164. This covered a small (kids size) plate of substandard English Breakfast, 2 ok-ish half bagels of haloumi and tuna mix, 2 small (kid‚Äôs portion) pancakes and a slice of rainbow cake. On a relative basis, this is arguably more expensive than the highest end restaurant in Abu Dhabi.

I made my feelings clear to the overstaffed crew. I might as well have spoken to the walls. No apology, no refund gesture, nothing!  

By a long way, this was the worst dining experience I have ever had. A few years back, I had a similar experience at the same place. I  could excuse the old experience because the place was busy and the staff were apologetic and rectified the matter. None of that this time round!

Never Again.

title: Inattentive and we probably made wrong choices
text:
Not the best experience. Arrived and no was looking after us - almost as if we were invisible? We had to go hunt for someone and then tell them can we have a table please?
Sat down and ordered milk shakes, pizza and steak sandwich.
Sat there for absolutely ages - seems it very busy but not enough waiting staff! 
No sign of drinks but food arrived. The pizza was anemic and not cooked properly. The steak sandwich did not look like the photo. The steak was like thin ham and very fatty. The vanilla milk shake tasted like it was made with almond milk? Imagine if I had an allergies?
However they were very good and did not charge us at all so it was good customer service. But we left hungry and very disappointed.

title: Fantastic Cafe - you MUST try the carrot cake
text:

title: Excellent Breakfast Experience
text:
Amazing Turkish breakfast experience, arguably, better than being in Turkey itself! If you are a family of 4-6, order the royal breakfast, a magical spread of hot and cold Turkish food (mezze style), pastries, eggs (to your liking), and endless refills of Turkish tea and bread baskets. 

Not only that, when u are done with the food, they take it all away, and serve you with milk pudding, chocolate baklava, Turkish delights and a massive bowl of fruits. 

They also put on a little dry ice ‚Äúshow‚Äù at the table for your little ones to enjoy. 

If you have guest from out of town and want to give them a ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù breakfast experience, that place is what you are looking for.

title: Preferential Treatment based on Etnicity
text:
LDC stands out as one of our favorite brunch destinations in Dubai due to its remarkable culinary offerings, which undeniably justify their price. However, I feel compelled to express my concern regarding a recurring issue we've experienced, wherein the manager appears to show preferential treatment towards Indian customers.

On two separate occasions, my family and I were denied seating on the couch, being informed that it was reserved for larger groups. Nevertheless, we couldn't help but notice that the same couch was later assigned to two Indian ladies. This biased treatment by the manager, Sunny, is deeply troubling and reflects negatively on the restaurant's reputation.

Despite this setback, I must commend the outstanding service provided by Tina, a gracious Filipina who consistently greets us warmly whenever we dine at the restaurant. Additionally, Jessie, a hardworking Filipino staff member, tirelessly accommodates every customer's request, even when visibly fatigued.

I sincerely hope that this review receives the attention of the management, urging them to reconsider their policy of seating customers based on their ethnicity. Fairness dictates that tables should be allocated on a first-come-first-served basis, regardless of one's background. Addressing this issue promptly will undoubtedly contribute to the restaurant's overall success and uphold its reputation as a welcoming and inclusive establishment.

title: Delightful experience
text:
We stumbled upon this place in JBR and it turned out to be a delightful surprise! We indulged in their waffles, sundaes, and of course, coffee. If you have a sweet tooth like me, you're in for a treat! Their gelato is a must-try creamy, delicious, and with a huge variety to choose from. The portions are generous, so you definitely won't leave feeling hungry.

The waffle was crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, topped with vanilla ice cream and fresh cream simply divine! Overall, a delightful experience for any ice cream lover

title: Finally, sundaes in Dubai with a view
text:
FINALLY an ice cream place with proper sundaes in Dubai AND with a nice view as well. I've no idea why the concept of sitting down to enjoy an icy dessert hasn't really caught on here, since it's the best place for it in the world. Fortunately Morelli's is there.

Also, sundaes offer a MUCH better value for the money there. Ice cream is good, service is very pleasant and attentive and all of the ladies are very friendly :)

title: A Fantastic Breakfast To Start The Day
text:
We started the day with a scrumptious breakfast spread at Hyatt Place Al Wasl.  It was a mix of American, Arabic, Chinese, Indian & Italian with a huge selection of breads and a minimum of two desserts.  There was a range of cereals, with milk, fresh cut fruits, an omelette station and coffee tea options too.

What I attacked first was the salad section that had a great selection of fresh and pickled veggies that I paired with fresh feta cheese, with some greens and Arabic pita bread.

I moved onto having a clear soup and some rice paired with Chinese gravy, that was decent.  I sampled some Mac n cheese with a side of spinach & corn too, it was delicious.

In the Indian selection, there was idly Sambar, chutneys and some pongal that was not too spicy, almost like a Kichidi, perfect for kids.

There was a good variety and standard on quality & service.  The coffee was top notch, the sausage were great, the omelettes could have been a bit fluffier, they were mostly flat

Overall a great spread that I indulged and ended with a fantastic cappuccino, and ready to be the tourist and start the sightseeing.

title: Amazing Dinner at Focus Restaurant, Hyatt Place AlRigga
text: My visit to Focus Restaurant was absolutely exceptional. Abu Bakar, Geeta, and Shanavas provided outstanding service, attending to me with a personal touch. Chef Mukesh and Chef Amrit prepared a delightful meal that included Cream of Mushroom Soup, Vegetable Manchurian, and Szechwan Chicken, perfectly tailored to my tastes. The food was superb and exactly what I had hoped for. Thank you for a wonderful dinner and the attentive, personalized care.

title: Try the Best Chicken Inasal in Dubai! (Next to Emirates Islamic Bank Rigga)
text: Inasal - is Ilongo (native Filipino dialect) term for ‚Äúchargrilled‚Äù or ‚Äúroasted meat‚Äù marinated with special herbs. There are lots of Mang Inasal branches in Dubai nowadays. But for me the most same marinate like the one in the Philippines, is the Mang Inasal in Rigga St, next to Emirates Islamic Bank formerly Gakos. The store was big, clean and huge that they can serve lots of people at a time. The staffs were great and attentive to your needs even if they have many customers. The chicken was so tender, nice to dip in with soy sauce chillies and ‚Äòkalamansi‚Äô (same as lime), served with unlimited rice and soup. And I need to specify the new menu, Enasaladang Bangus- crispy fried milkfish with tomato ensalada, so delicious! Other Filipino dishes and desserts available. The only doubt for me is if its legit franchise of Mang Inasal as all of the logos of Mang Inasal here in Dubai were all the same. But still, Good Job and More Power.

title: A marvelous chicken by Mang Inasal Al Rigga
text:
The long queues and seemingly never empty stalls of Mang Inasal have always piqued my interest when I was still living in the Philippines üáµüá≠. While Filipinos are admittedly natural food enthusiasts, there has got to be an ultimate X-factor that keeps the people coming. Is it the tasty food? The cheap prices? Or perhaps all of the above?

Mang Inasal is a fast-food chain notorious for its bestseller, inasal na manok, which is available in two parts: paa or pecho. Covered with spices and grilled over a pit, the chicken inasal can serve as a satisfying viand even without the complementary condiments or sawsawan (soy sauce with calamansi & chili üå∂ ). For only 18 & 19 aed you can avail a meal comprising of chicken inasal with unlimited rice üçö 

Mapapawow ka sa Sarap at unli rice pa the best Filipino dish ever we absolutely loved it.

title: Fantastic service and great food
text:
We had a most breathtaking experience of gastronomic pleasure here last night. We searched for good hotpot places and arbitrarily chanced upon this place after reading the reviews. 
This was our first touchdown with hotpot and it was superhit. 
The restaurant is very typically chinese starting from the outside to inside. All the internal decor with high dark open ceilings to abundance of chinese lanterns of different sizes and artforms with nice nooks and corners- a delightful place.
The staffs are a class apart- remembering Mr. Rehan, Mr. Ali, Ms. Chang here- all of them when we may need something and how to guide us.
They do have ala karte options too whih might suit many diners.
The menus were very colourful and with pictures depicting the items- which is of great help.
The Hotpot comes in Spicy, Basic bland and a mix of both -versions, we took the mix where the pot has two distinct separate sections of spicy and bland versions. After having both the versions- I preferred the bland simple side more. 
You can put 42 types of raw fresh food of veg and nonveg varieties in ready to cook slices , in the pot and cook for roughly 15 mins- when it gets ready. After that you can continue putting items as per your choices and this can go on with unlimited quantity. There can be a small restriction though- if it's busy, the time limit is 2 hrs and also please don't take anything you can't eat- basically don't waste. 
So plan your meal beforehand, if possible. 
There are around 6 types of barbecue grills in this package which includes fish and chicken among others. Also 4 types of desserts- chinese sweets , and a soft drink. The sweets included sesame balls and potato balls with purple yum stuffing. I have heard about the golden buns but it was not to my liking.
The total of this unbelievable and humongous menu is only 49 dhs per person. It's an earth' shattering price and we recommend it absolutely.
Theare some combinations of raw spices which can be put in with mixtures of different quantities to produce a most delectable sauce. This sauce is to be added to the cooked items and savoured to your heart's content. 
Our most favourite items were Crabs, Crab balls, Australian lamb, Chicken fillets, Kankong greens, Fish tofu and so on. We took second helpings of the crab balls and BBQ chicken wings too. They also had at least 3 types of Mushrooms, squid, crab sticks etc.
Authentic cutleries added to the traditional values and experience. 
I had a Plum drink from china, which was separate from the soft drinks and it was at 8 dhs for a large bottle. 
The walls are full of praises and heartfelt outpourings of love from very satisfied customers and we too duly added our notes of appreciation to the wall arts as well as to the staff columns. 
We were really touched by the personalised services and very helpful attitude with smiles from all the staffs. 
We wish all the best for their success and future endeavours.

title: ‚ÄúThe size of the room is generous. The staff super. The hotel is really clean.  Lovely breakfast and near a metro.
text:
Featuring fitness centre, a sun terrace with a swimming pool and a bar, Hyatt Place Dubai/Wasl District is located in Dubai, 36 km from Aquaventure Waterpark and 6 km from Grand Mosque. Among the facilities of this property are a restaurant, a 24-hour front desk and room service, along with free WiFi. The hotel has newspapers and a fax machine and photocopier that guests can use.

At the hotel, every room comes with a desk, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom. At Hyatt Place Dubai/Wasl District every room includes a seating area.

A continental breakfast is available daily at the accommodation.

Dubai World Trade Centre is 8 km from Hyatt Place Dubai/Wasl District, while Mall of the Emirates is 24 km away. The nearest airport is Dubai airport, 8 km from the hotel.

This area is also great for shopping, with popular brands nearby: Nike

title: A Sham ! Disappointed !
text:
I am extremely disappointed with Coffee Club. In particular, the Wasl Vita Branch in Dubai. My recent visit left a bad taste in my mouth. 

They currently have a happy hour promotion for beverages between 3-6 pm where they give you 40% off the beverages. (However, they refused to give me my discount !!!). I even wrote to the manager who could be least bothered. She said "she raised the complaint internally and address all issues I had raised". No apologies whatsoever, no compensation for having over-paid despite the promotion !!

This is what had happened.  I visited with a friend at 5pm and we first ordered some juices (quite pricey at normal pricing) and also ordered small starters and salads. These were ok and nothing to write home about. There are way better places in Dubai for food & drinks. 

We then ordered another round of juices at around 6pm. Following that we ordered coffees at around 7.30pm.

The service was EXTREMELY and painfully slow. It took us almost 30 mins to get the bill and that too after summoning the waitress and finally going up to the counter.

They are under-staffed. Initially, for COVID, they had reduced the seating area, but when we went recently, they increased the seating area, yet there was only one waitress running around so you can't  really blame her.

When we called the bill, Happy Hour discount was not applied. When we asked why, they said because we called the bill at 8pm and happy hour is till 7 is what they told us.

I told them you should have informed us so that we could have closed that bill and got the discounts at least for the 4 earlier beverages and then we could start a new tab. They said the waitress was supposed to inform us but she forgot !!

Great ! Their mistake, we suffer and pay way more.

There was NO apology from the staff or the manager and they could not care less.

Needless to say, I won't be giving them my business any more. 

My recommendation is, Go to other GREAT coffee shops in Dubai where the service and standards are way better and the staff care about their customers.

text:

The food was delicious, I ate the Salmon with Kale :) 

This will definitely become my regular, meet up spot !!!

title: Great food and coffee!
text: The Coffee Club is my family‚Äôs favorite venue for breakfast, lunch and dinner. This month they‚Äôve launched a vegan menu and we paid them a visit to try it. We visited the DIFC location which is lovely and also offers outdoor seating area. Their vegan menu offers a good range of dishes including vegan desserts too. We had the hummus trio with crispy tortilla, eggplant and freekeh salad, plant-based burger from beyond meat, vegan pasta with spinach pesto, coconut cashew brownie and key lime pie. Everything was delicious and flavorful, we only found the pasta bland. Ended our lunch with their perfectly brewed coffee. The Coffee Club‚Äôs vegan menu is available in all the locations in UAE and it is absolutely worth trying!

title: Nice Coffee place !
text: Had lunch cum coffee and had a good experience. Love to go back and look and feel of the coffee shop are nice

title: The best
text: One of the best restaurant to have  breakfast,lunch ,dinner along with perfect spot for client meetins. Food is just amazing and so healthy. One of my best place for regular and casual visits.

title: Not Recommended
text:
Driver picked us up from our hotel and dropped us off in a car park 25 minute walk to the boat, very hot in July!
Boat was nice, toilets were clean at the start of the cruise but then swamped with water later on.
The show was meh, a man spinning round and round, there was no puppet show.
The food looked nice but beware 3/5 of us had diarrhoea and vomiting that night and all next day.
I do not recommend this.
Also check the reviews and discount those where the person has only done one review as these are generally fake!

text:

The meat was perfectly toasted abd hummus, garlic sauce, and veggies all tasted fresh. The juice was also fresh and tasty. Things were prepared and served relatively quickly.

Over the years the quality has become bad. Not worth price dhs :8/- paid for. Rating: 1/5.  Better have in roadside  small cafeterias where food  is best and hot.

title: Bad experience
text: I recently had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The man who took my order seemed inexperienced and struggled to manage even basic requests. Unfortunately, this wasn't the worst part of my visit. On multiple occasions, I received meals that were cold. When I called to address this issue, I was met with dishonesty, as they insisted the meals were freshly prepared. text: Visited this place during dinner time , ordered for grape mint shisha within 5 mins , the Shisha did not last for more than 20 mins we informed the shisha server plenty of times but he couldn‚Äôt fix it so we left the shisha as it is . Ordered for hummus , Moutabal both of them were not fresh like the other places . Halloumi was very good in taste , also ordered for lamb chops which was dry blank not juicy at all. The mix grill was good the shish tawooks and kababs tasted good . When it comes to the staff and the service of this place it‚Äôs too notch but when you can‚Äôt serve good food & Shisha it turns out to be a bad experience for us . Hopefully the team rectify the quality issues .

text: This restaurant is our favourite in the world. The whole family is amazed by the variety of this amazing syrian restaurant. The taste of all food and desserts is just unbelievable. Whenever we are in Dubai, our first thing to do is eat in Al Hamidieh.

text: Want Great Shisha and amazing food? Come to this place! The entire staff is amazing! I have been coming here for many years and they have never disappointed me! Baharawi is the best! Best shisha guy ever!

text: the fish was mediocre, but the mango juice was lovely and also the staff were very nice. and while the location was near the creek and nice, the smell of decay was not totally appetizing. i would suggest to give this one a miss as there are many, many nicer fish places and arabic food in dubai.

I don't think it's worth a special trip, but if you're already nearby, it's definitely should be your first option.

title: Really bad
text:
First of all i got a tea... just a brewed tea bag (from a supermarket). for 15 aed. centuries of arabic tea culture was ashamed and i was offended as a guest.
Also a fish wasn't properly prepared. There are scales on the skin a parts of a spinal bone and lots of bones in general (when you serve a fish in an "open style" you should make it like a filet)
I think a chef should learn basics of cooking, and waiters be more trained. Rice was ok.
Just my opinion. 
Bad service and cousins for high price.
Life hack: You can get the same dish in a supermarket Nesto for 20 aed. i paid 80.

title: delicious mutton
text: it was the perfect taste of mutton i‚Äôve ever tasted. the staff ‚ÄúKim‚Äù was also very friendly l, accommodating. me and my friends enjoyed it.

title: Good üòä
text: The emirati food taste's good and satisfying, good servings also. As for the services, they are friendly and approachable.

title: Emirati Taste
text:
In the middle of the traditional part of Al Seef, by a little square overloking the creek, is this restaurant, which offers - as it says on a board outside - 'Emirati Taste'. This is what made me sit down here. The tables, of metal with an oval shape and a high edge all around, are not too comfortable for eating, but the location with seating partly under a portico, partly under tents or then just by the creek, is attractive.

Going there twice for dinner I was first served by a friendly young lady, probably a Filipina, while on the second evening an Arab type woman with a Hijab was in charge, who was hardly paying any attention to her customers. For payment an Indian looking man showed up.

My choices for dinner were once a Machboos, a popular dish in several Gulf countries. It is well spiced rice, that could be had at this restaurant with chicken, beef, shrimps or - the most expensive - with hamour. Under that name go various fish here, usually a kind of grouper. I went for the fish variety. It was nicely served with a plate cover and it was a very big portion, which I could not finish. It tasted very good though.

On my second evening I went for Fareed (more often known as 'Thareed'), a very typical Emirati dish, consisting of Regag flat bread covered with Chicken Saloona, thus a stew in a tomato based broth with onions, garlic, ginger and vegetables like carrots and eggplants. I didn't particularly like this dish with the soggy bread and an overall rather strange taste of the here yellow coloured Saloona.

title: Made like an old village
text: Made like an old village on the waterfront, not really impressed with it or what‚Äôs in it but seen it but would not go back as once was enough.

title: Nice place
text:
The most unusual Starbucks I've ever entered! It is located in a traditional building in Al Seef, a neighborhood in which the appearance of old Dubai has been preserved.
It is not very big, but it has an interesting, rustic appearance. In the back there is also a small terrace overlooking Dubai Creek.
The staff is kind. You can pay by card.

title: Rubbish
text:
Used to be one of my favorite restaurants & I posted an excellent review few months ago

Last 3 times I noticed service & food became worse and worse

Credit card machine never works since 3 months

Stacc doesn't understand English well and don't bother to do what customers ask

I said no ice in juice he smiled and bought with ice

I asked food spicy he said yes and it wasn't spicy

Taste of food gone down

Portion size has reduced a lot

title: Very good
text:
Al Hamidieh is one of my favorite names in Dubai for eating Arabic food....
went there with my family and we ordered the mixed grilled meat as well as the chicken filled with rice. For the dessert we ordered the candy ice cream cake, unfortunately the ice cream was too cold (a bit hard to eat straight away) compare to the other Hamidieh Resturant. Still was a good overall experience for my family.

title: Very Good
text: Al Hamidieh Marsa Al Seef, serving traditional Syrian dishes. Unfortunately the area has become deserted but surprisingly the food was Very Good with the exception of the dessert which was average.  During winter time when the weather is pleasant you can use the terrace which has nice views overlooking the creek.

title: 90 minutes inside a James Bond movie.
text: My wife and I had a late lunch at Al Hamidieh in Al Seef which is  a beautiful historic neighborhood in Dubai. Food was absolutely delicious, service fast and friendly, but the most exciting thing was the view of Dubai Creek from the open veranda. I literally felt inside a James Bond movie.

text: We had a great table on the terrace in the shadow, with very good food, a bit touristy from the inside. Local food is very tasty

text: Table was dirty,  food was frozen and untasty. By far the worse avocado juice i have seen in my entore life. Wi-fi wasnt working. Hommos without a drop of olive oil.

title: Stunning views üôå
text: Stunning views and lovely place to relax while abras are sliding through the water right next to you. The humus and small dishes to share are great! Alcohol is being served. üî•

title: Less than average service and food quality. Seating outside is nice but spoiled with the smell of others smoking
text:
Less than average service and food quality. Seating outside is nice but spoiled with the smell of others smoking 
Hummus spoiled with burnt old meat.  Grilled meat tasted salt and lots and lots of blackpeper.... the service is really bad.

title: Amazing View of the Creek
text:
Offering a magnificent view of the Creek, we have Times of Arabia resting in the middle of Al Seef. While we have many restaurants choices in this area, this Middle Eastern restaurant seems to blend in with its environment effortlessly.

We tried the Hummus Beiruti which is served with the complimentary Khubz.¬† It has a refreshing yet subtle spicy flavour which makes it a better option than the classic Hummus dish. We also tried the Meat Arayes plate which is minced mutton stuffed in pita bread. It had great flavour and went well with the Hummus Beiruti.

They also serve alcohol and shisha (outdoors) making this place an ideal place to unwind with friends or after work.

The servers are polite and the price range is fair for the portion size offered. Overall a nice place to visit.¬†

title: the worst service in dubai!
text: we came for a lunch and it was Eid celebration. the food was tasty, evrything was nice. But the waiter was extremely rude! His name is Muhamad (not sure if its his real name , he is with grey hair and never know how to smile) . He was inpolite and was behaving like we came to his home not to the restaurant. in the end he proposed us tea, we didnt want it that much, but we thought its arabic tea which restaurants giving complimentary after food, so we said okay, bcos our drinks finished. In all restaurants its free and complimentary . but here they charged us extra 50 aed ! when we started to complain he didnt even had answer, so if its not free why he didjt ask which tea we like ? maybe read black green fruit ? we didnt mention as we were sure its arabic complimentary tea. anyway, this Muhamad was talking with us in very rude manner, he was even telling me ‚Äúlisten its not my problem‚Äù, imagine ??? so think many times before u go to this place as u will face disgusting person there which will destroy all your satisfaction with tasty food

text:
We had gone to the coffee club opened new in The Meadows Souk Dubai for lunch. They had enough vegetarian options. The pizzas were very small but taste was good. The quinoa salad was good. The staff was friendly & were very flexible to add or remove something from items we ordered. 
Only thing that we found ok was the molten cake, they served it to us in 5mins & i asked a molten cake normally takes 20mins howcome its come in 5mins? I asked if it was warmed in a microwave & she said yes. That molten cake was less than warm that they really need to improve. Its good would definitely go again to any of their branches & would definitely recommend to all.
